V_IGKvvDlyA8FILwNwEgbg.text: Damned if this place doesn't make one tasty burger ... I was skeptical, and when they first opened it was a bit wonky. But now? Pretty well oiled machine. Plus its one of the few casual burger places who will actually cook your burger the way you ask! Medium rare? They do it. I've not ventured too far off the menu. The double thin burger - as listed - is the best imo. I tried a thick burger with swiss once and it wasn't as good. Tater tots seem to work. Super thin breaded fried onions are fun. Now I'm craving burgers when I didn't much in my life. Thanks Wahlburgers.

pFzM1XAj9Ky48SETDz9dtg.text: Good burgers, good price,nothing to brag about but nothing to complain about! We will be back when the hype calms down the wait is insane!

TbJtkJdTY8A5qibUAq975w.text: So I wanted to just be blown away as Wahlburgers became my new craving. We drove up to the Pittsburgh location which is in a nice space. It's a cool comfortable and engaging space. Gotta love their ability to self promote! We were seated right away and attended to by some very friendly staff. Menus were distributed and drinks followed almost immediately. As it was the first time we all decided to go with the house burger, onion rings and macaroni salad were ordered for dinner. I'm going a little backward here as we also ordered Chef Paul's take on poutine. Now to be fair I didn't actually read the description I was just asked if I wanted It. I love love love a good poutine so this should be really nice. Fairly quickly our appetizer was delivered and, well it didn't look like poutine at all. Kinda looked like loaded fries or loaded pork nachos but definitely not poutine. Fries, nacho looking cheese sauce, bbq sauce, pulled pork etc.... as a poutine type dish very disappointing. That being said as a loaded pork fries it's was pretty good, just not my thing. Dinner arrived nice and hot and looking great. The sides are rather large so sharing is in order. The burger was a little lost in the bun, I shifted it forward for the picture, but it was hot cooked well and had good flavor. It's a good solid burger for sure, not crave worthy as I had hoped but good. The sides were also pretty good. The onion rings and thinner than thin and a bit greasy, only a few of those got eaten even though they did have good taste. Alma's macaroni salad was the winner for me. Tasted like homemade macaroni salad that mom would make. In the end we all liked Wahlburgers and would go back but probably wouldn't go too far out of the way to find one.

photos.caption: Photo of Wahlburgers - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

GDvvkBDgPyS6LtSld8v__A.text: Second time here and still wasn't impressed. The first time I went, I got the sloppy joe which was cold and the wait times were horrible. This second time I got a burger and it was dry. It had no flavor and seemed to be over cooked. The waiter didn't seem to care and wasn't really attentive.

ZFTtT3k4eIT38lC8GHBw-Q.text: I was expecting more as a burger place. Nothing necessarily bad tasting but it's expensive for the amount of food you get and I think other burger places are more worth the calories!

wJCMrg4sSudT8VwmZYgsQA.text: We were really excited to try a new burger joint but I can say with confidence that we will not be back. We waited 20 minutes before anyone even came to our table to get drink orders. We were told a manager would be sent to the table to speak with us about the service, but we never saw one. Once ordering, it took nearly 40 minutes to get out food. Not worth the time and frustration.

uzOmxABpS7xlUvt3zUokYg.text: Great burgers and great service. Loved the turkey burger with cranberry and stuffing. Will definitely be going back

8folNRs-hITuiCqrrSzGpw.text: We are a family of four eating here. I would like to say shame on the Wahlberg family for putting their name on such mediocre food. The menu is limited and the execution is lackluster. I feel like they are trying to use their celebrity status to dazzle and distract from the disappointing food.   I ordered the O.F.D. Medium rare. It had a tomato jam that was too sweet. Other than the jam, the burger was bland. The kids Mac and cheese has artificial smoke flavor added and neither of my children would eat it. We wouldn't recommend.

ai3HqKgGY-Tflxe4-NKsHQ.text: Quick and easy! Good place to go for a delicious burger. Has been consistent quality each time

JBSVrXZ_QISxV9bYbMkFFw.text: First timers here and experience was fantastic!  Our server was Jillian G, who knew the menu inside and out, gave great suggestions and was very attentive - keeping our drinks filled and also entertaining our 2 yr. old son, who was on overload from the TV's going and all the people milling around.  Hubby had the BBQ Bacon Burger and tots which he really enjoyed, I had the "Our Burger" with x pickles - omg that Wahl sauce is fab!! Wahl sauce+ tots=heaven!  Pickles are house made and delicious.  I ordered a side (1/2 side) of Alma's macaroni, which could easily feed 3-4 people, so I took the rest to go.  LO had the Smahlburger and he ate the entire thing - I loved that it came with fries, but $2.75 additional for milk was kind of crazy.  We are used to kid's meals including the drink.  Other than the "new kid" at the front who was learning how to pretty much work with the public for the first time ever (he ignored people standing right in front of him in the middle of the conversation/checking them in to answer the phone, but never said "excuse me" or anything), we'd definitely come back again.  Bottom line: Food is good, burgers aren't greasy or messy and everything was fresh.  Good place to take your family or hang out at the bar with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Wahlburgers - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. &#34;Our Burger&#34; delicious!
Photo of Wahlburgers - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 1/2 order of Alma&#39;s macaroni... Huge!!
Photo of Wahlburgers - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu

6izLpl9CL3MhB-GuTM3z1Q.text: I was overly excited about this restaurant opening. I went there shortly after it opened. I thought the menu was small. I ordered a burger. Mediocre at best.  But I thought I'd give it another try. This time I ordered the salad with grilled portabella. What a waste of money. The salad consisted of mixed greens a few diced tomatoes, red onion and maybe 8 very small pieces of portabella. I will not return.

zYmgotTTUV-AHwHzUAmuqQ.text: The food is pretty decent. But they grossly misquoted the wait time today. They told me 30-45 min, I returned after 42 minutes of waiting, and there were still about 6 parties that needed to be sat, which is about 20-30 more minutes at least. Just very disappointed with the waste of time as we had to be at work and couldn't wait any longer.

Yvwbbp2A4SWvAYN7LC5IGQ.text: We've been there twice and we love the burgers!!!  Definitely in my top 2 now.  Our kids love their chicken nuggets and Mac&cheese too. Great staff are a plus-plus!!!

E9gayEFAAB3OfVaEGCdyFQ.text: Pretty decent.  I got a Walhburger and onion straws.  The burger was good, better than Five Guys and Burgatory, but probably not as good as Red Robin (yum).  I like that they don't try to kill you with beef like they do at Five Guys and Burgatory.  I like a good balance of beef and toppings.  If all you can taste is bland ground beef (like at Burgatory especially), in my opinion you've done something really wrong.  The onion straws were tasty, and they give you way too many.  Would have been better if I had two or 3 people to share with as an appetizer.  I can't speak to the service as I got this delivered with Ubereats, but overall I'd definitely order from them again.

aL4iCscAKziXkA2MVwSj2Q.text: We had really high hopes for this place! It's in an excellent location, and it has a seemingly relaxed atmosphere. When we walked in, there was an employee on the floor, organizing t-shirts, but no one at the front desk. We waited for about a minute, and the employee on the floor finally addressed us. She then said that she would go find a place for us to sit. She disappeared. A few other employees came by, and they all gathered around the front desk. One person asked how many were in our party, and we told them that a woman had already taken that and was looking for our table. That woman then came back and stood around with the other employees, not addressing us. Someone else then offered to take us to our table.  The atmosphere was very nice, we did really like the outdoor seating. Then we met our waiter. He very slowly approached our table, and seemed really relaxed. At first, that didn't seem so bad at all. When we ordered, half of what we wanted was already not available. We had to then change our order. He brought us our first round of drinks, then left. We did not get a refill until our food arrived, even though we were out of something to drink a while before hand. His relaxed demeanor turned into more of a problem.  Another employee brought our food out, but wasn't sure which burger belonged to whom. She then started lifting the burger bun up and looking at both of them so that she could tell the difference. This took her a second, and she just continuously messed with our food. She then dropped our food off and very quickly left, before we could even ask for silverware. We then had to wait for our original waiter to return so that we could get our silverware.  The food was fine, not great. The order was partially incorrect (my salad had the wrong dressing and I was too hungry to correct it). The side salad consisted of lettuce, tomatoes, a few cucumbers, and a lot of onions.  It took forever for our waiter to return to give us the check. When he did, he made a comment about our last name and how he couldn't pronounce it. He then sauntered away.  The one thing we truly appreciated was the calorie listing on the menu. That just makes it easy whenever you are being health conscious. They also offer a variety of healthy choices.  Honestly, if one of these things had occurred, it would not have been a big deal. It was a combination of all of it. Maybe we caught them on a bad night. Maybe they need to reconsider their staff. We likely will not be returning because of this experience, which is a shame. I actually created a yelp account just because of this experience, if that tells you anything.

hz4MMbhFil8SEx4JJ2koaA.text: If you can find the restaurant hidden in the back of the block "mall", it's pretty good! We really enjoyed their burgers. They even make their own ranch and have vegetarian burgers. Totally worth it if you're in the area!

bCyDaweaZw0_BujAeP8RzQ.text: The food was a slight step up from an Applebee's, and it was a bit over priced. The only reason to come is for the Wahlburg name.

BClAzw8LEP0oPZkTBb_47g.text: I had dinner here a couple weeks ago and I was disappointed. There's a lot of hype behind the food here and I just thought it was mediocre. I got the sloppy joe and that was decent but my husband got a burger and it reminded us of a 5 Guys style burger but not quite as good. For sides, we had the tater tots and the Mac and cheese. Both were mediocre. On the positive side, the space is very nice, they have a lot of outdoor seating upstairs on the balcony, you can put yourself on the wait list through Yelp, and the service was friendly. Also we didn't leave there smelling like burgers, which was surprising. We might try it again but aren't rushing to go back.

NoGx6GfOQY7prh5WiPRdUg.text: Love this place! Wait staff is awesome! Food is great. Energetic and fun place! We will return.

gamzQDSPWNxiVkhRAzKWJQ.text: I had probably unrealistic hopes for this place, like thought it was going to be the best burger I ever had. The food was good though nothing spectacular. The oil that they use to fry their foods left a weird after taste in my mouth, almost like it had gone a tad rancid which I wasn't a fan of. Service was good though! We put our name in on no wait but still had a decent wait, and they gave us free French fries (that we definitely didn't ask for) to hold our kids over.

Um91Nw6ilBQ8lZ7rXbZ6YA.text: Very slow and messed up orders for an empty restaurant... all I can say about this place is that it's an overpriced steak and shake. Sides are an upcharge to the already small beef patties. I would not recommend this place, but if you are a fan of the show or the actor don't get your hopes up

XDZCxGfI20xBGtWlYs18BQ.text: My husband and I have been to Wahlburgers a few times since they opened a little while ago, which speaks to the quality of food.   First and foremost, they use the No Wait app, so they win points in my book. The burgers are good and the ingredients taste fresh. We've run into some trouble with our burgers being cooked to order, but it was never so bad that we sent anything back. The service has always been good as well.  Four stars because of the a la carte menu style. You think you're getting a good deal for an $8 burger until you realize that fries are something like an additional $4 and mac n cheese is like $6.   That being said, we'll definitely be back again.

Qsd9eLqhJlp4-PEKI629Jg.text: This was my first time, and I have to say that it was awesome! I got the BBQ bacon burger that is Donnie's favorite. It has a good vibe; service was great. Only complaint, I guess, is the price is a bit hight on some things. Maybe your just paying for the name, but it is not terrible.

vjhMGPu8KuxapRiMey9Oiw.text: Wahlburgers is pretty good. I like the fact I can get a beer and I'm sure others appreciate the cocktails. My first visit was a late lunch and I sat in the bar. The bartender was very friendly and the service was awesome. My second visit was dinner during Happy Hour. I sat out on the deck and the service was also good. Both times I had the "OurBurger" and I liked it a lot. I liked the tater tots much better than the fries. I will have to try the sweet potato tots next time.

yyjTkCMM0MYoJkP8pZ8zUA.text: I came here and I got the portobello sandwich. Our guests got the triple decker and the original burger. The waitress didn't write our order down. Items were forgot and the kids meal was wrong. Pleas encourage the waitress/waiter to use pen and paper.

xFemMN_fUJ6wDLfOHHERdA.text: This my new favorite burger spot. Everything is delicious. I even ordered food to take home with me. Alysia is the best server!! I recommend the Our and Pierogis burger and the fried pickles. Can't go wrong with a cupcake to finish off a epic meal and then some.

rcAQiligFpljzXhhLnOM4Q.text: Food wasn't bad. A little pricey for what you get, and all sides are extra. I'd say fun experience once and than I'd be over getting a thin burger for 15 bucks

b9wLk37xJkCJx6uavb_F8w.text: I'm sad.  Very sad.  I had high hopes.  If it weren't for the good service I wouldn't have any stars to give.  We went for dinner and it was a bad decision.  I ordered  their Wahlburger with bacon.  Our waitress asked how I wanted it cooked and I asked for Medium.  It took quite a while for our food to come.  The minute I saw the premade perfectly round burger patty my hope started drifting down the drain.  It had no flavor.  None.  It was also WELL DONE.  IF it had any flavor it was cooked out.  The lettuce was shredded like the paper you put in decorative baskets.  It was green but it was wimpy, almost soggy.  It added nothing to the burger.  I CAN say that the house made Ranch dressing that I dipped my almost cold fries in was the best part of the meal.  IF that is the best thing you can say then I think that speaks volumes.

photos.caption: Photo of Wahlburgers - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sloppy Joe
Photo of Wahlburgers - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tater tots
Photo of Wahlburgers - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Onion rings

YyhnsglBynQPd5hqrd7yUQ.text: I happen to be at The Container Store and noticed Wahlburgers as I was driving by so I thought why not! I had the option of sitting at the bar, in the dining room or on the balcony; and since the weather was so beautiful I opted for the balcony. My waitress Chatara was excellent. Super friendly and very attentive throughout the meal. She asked if it was my first time there and proceeded to tell me some of her favorite things off the menu, I ended up going with the sloppy joe that she recommended and also a side of sweet potato tots.  The food came out really quickly, I was actually quite surprised. The sweet potato tots came in a little cardboard bowl and the sloppy joe filled up the plate along with some slices of pickles.  All of the food tasted great. The sloppy joe was actually very mild in flavor, so if you are someone who is used to eating Manwich sloppy joes the flavor on this is much less pronounced!  You could definitely tell that it was homemade. The crispy onion rings on top were a nice addition, as were the pickle slices. The cheese sauce and the wahl sauce we're also quite unusual I thought for a sloppy joe but gave it that something special. Wahl sauce is a mixture of ketchup, mayonnaise, sriracha, sauteed onions and parsley. The sweet potato tots were just as I expected, nothing unusual there. Overall, my experience at walburgers was a good one. I will definitely bring my husband next time. Hopefully I can try one of their adult fraps!  They also offer a 10% military discount.

photos.caption: Photo of Wahlburgers - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sloppy Joe and Sweet Potato Tots
Photo of Wahlburgers - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beer Selections
Photo of Wahlburgers - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Happy Hour Specials and wine

fnr7ozq4nIkpqR1fEySOjw.text: In June of this year, back in Wexford for our family gathering, my experience, the 1st, at new Wahlburgers in Ross Twp. It was outstanding.  I was there by myself, on a weekday morning (11;15).  I met the manager, and was impressed with her acumen and restaurant experience. Ordered the house standard cheeseburger and onion rings, perfectly cooked and delicious. I'm writing this now, after reading all the mediocre reviews in the past six months, and asking myself, what has changed with the restaurant personnel?  (I recommended this location to my brother...he went and liked it, but noticed,  with weekend crowd, very high noise levels make conversation difficult.) I rate this particular Wahlbergers better than the one in Atlanta, GA.   Located in the Battery complex, part of the new Suntrust Stadium where the MLB Braves play.  The day I visited Kennesaw State had a football game, and we waited 90 minutes ( with an earlier reservation) to get seated, at 2PM.  Same meal, cheeseburger and onion rings...did not measure up in quality, nor freshness, compared to my memory of the Ross Twp. experience. Probably, the staff was exhausted after dealing with the crush of local and JAX FL football fans.  Still, I'm a fan.

Q1VtUuqfGdf9WsBlIcpO-Q.text: It's ok. There are better burgers and better food and drinks. You get charged restaurant prices for paper plates and take out level product. Not worth it. Was really hoping this was more than just the Wahlburg name but let's face it, that's what it is. If you didn't know the name of the place, you wouldn't come back. And I'm not going to either.

lgOLhljV2flxNdzziPbjRQ.text: We were visiting Pittsburgh for the Thanksgiving holiday and wanted to try Wahlburgers. We went on Black Friday 11/23/18 and surprisingly it wasn't too crazy. The first issue was the sound. I brought my 83 yo mother and my son and we couldn't even hear each other talk over the music. Thank god my 88 yo dad didn't come because he definitely wouldn't have heard a thing. We were seated in a booth which I liked. The booths are much more private than the tables with steel chairs. We ordered 2 Our burgers and some type of bacon burger, tater tots, French fries, macaroni salad and soft drinks. We enjoyed everything but the macaroni salad which was bland. It was basically macaroni and mayo. When the macaroni arrived at the table it came with a plastic fork. We were sharing it and it could have used a serving spoon. Th server gave us paper side bowls for the macaroni salad and silverware but only after the food was served. The burgers were very good and so were the tots and fries but they definitely could have been hotter not lukewarm. I would have liked to try the shakes and the bar but we were too full. My mom said she wouldn't go back but I would give it a try. The server was friendly and did give us tips on ordering.

dJfBmf_qFX7TDFTYW87PPA.text: Stopped in for a mid day lunch.  It was busy but plenty of tables were open.  Service was freindly and good.  Ordered the Our Burger that has lettuce, tomato, onion, cheese and Paul's housemade sauce & pickles.  Loved the homemade pickles.  The burgers are cooked to medium well unless you specify differently.  My burger was very good and a nice option and I though the pricing was very good.  Had a side of the sweet potato tots that were  sweet and very good.  Wahlburger's menu does have some sandwiches and salads, a plant based impossible burger and a turkey burger for those that do not want a beef burger.

nkj2rDDev44Z2G9zg64dXA.text: Decided that we would have dinner on a Friday evening. They are on the no wait app and had no wait, so why not try it out. They get a solid 4. We were greeted warmly by the hostesses and we were promptly seated. We were waited on by our phenomenal waitress. She was on it. She was there but not overbearingly so. We started with drinks. Hubby got a beer. I chose their white sangria. It was terrific! Not too sweet, not too dry. I got the Thanksgiving turkey burger. It was tasty. They put a mayo and cranberry combo on the burger which provided the perfect balance of sweet and tangy. The burger comes with stuffing on it. It was quite tasty. Solid! The hubby got a burger done to his liking with mushrooms and a tomato relish. He said he could have done without the relishy stuff but liked the burger overall. We got the fries, tater tots, and sweet potato tots. I LOVED the sweet potato tots. They were awesome!!! Overall, a solid meal. We would certainly go back!

HkyX3sEphDq0UHsR2w8_tQ.text: I really enjoy this place- the highlights:  Excellent burgers. Generously portioned and cooked to order   Onion rings are wonderful   Creative drink selection and menu  Friendly staff  Outdoor seating, which is uncommon in this neck of the woods   Things I don't like:  The French fries are not good. They're frozen, and not even good frozen fries.   To dovetail with the above, at $3.50, they aren't a very good value.   In closing, I really enjoy the restaurant. They are a welcomed addition to The Block. Cool atmosphere, great staff... just please cut your own fries!

14W1ouiZjxc5rYL0JGIWpw.text: There is no variety in the menu and it is completely overrated. Considering the prices, it most definitely does not meet expectations.

dl--XtoZdKj0al2e738V_Q.text: We showed up in this restaurant at 9:45 PM, although the restaurant was scheduled to close at 10 PM. The hostess/waitress led us to a booth. A couple of other tables of customers were still in the restaurant. We ordered our hamburgers, fries, onion rings, and root beer float. Our food was brought to our table at 9:58 PM. My husband was brought fries rather than onion rings, but we did not mention the mistake to the waitress because it was almost closing time. She was friendly and checked in with us off and on to make sure that we were happy with the food. The burgers seemed to a good quality, and we enjoyed the taste. The fries were fries.  4-28-2018 update: I ate at this restaurant again this week. My husband really likes their hamburgers. He thinks that the hamburgers are the best in Pittsburgh. Today I ordered macaroni salad, which was 5 stars, and a grilled cheese sandwich, which was 4 stars. The waitress did not bring out my macaroni or utensils, so I had to ask for them. She also fumbled with our payment at the end.

OXq8vw_6zLxcxB1leWfFqw.text: I arrived T Wahlburgers around 8:45 abs there was no wait - the staff was very friendly and my server was super helpful with food recommendations as this was my first time dining here. I ordered the sweet potato tater tots and onion rings as appetizers and both my boyfriend and I ordered the OFD Burger ( meat patty with Swiss. Here's, bacon, sauteed mushrooms and tomato jam - I am not a huge fan of the jam so I opted for the famous Wahl sauce instead) ordered the burger medium- well. This burger was so delicious and cooked to perfection ! The Wahl sauce was like a thousand island dressing with a zing and very complimenting to the burger . Both apps were very good - the onion rings were thin and. Rusty just as advertised - very good flavor . The sweet tater tots were amazing as I had never had anything like this before. Dipped in ketchup was good but I think they should serve it with a cream sauce for dipping ( or even the Wahl sauce would be amazing ) overall I had the perfect experience here - I am looking forward to returning - I am going to try the Sloppy Joe next time . Thank you Wahlburgers.

ObFF6_2Neu6-qPydnPl0Gw.text: Tasty grub. Server asked us right off the bat if we had any dietary restrictions. We didn't, but it was pleasantly surprising to get that type of question at this tier of restaurant. Food was delicious. Service was fantastic

YoLyDYWQPnyTbBBlMP248w.text: Really 2.5.  Not judging on the atmosphere, as it's a chain and these people have no say. But customer service is key. Which unfortunately was somewhat lacking. We witnessed two other parties having issues at the same time as us, so maybe just a bad night? The server did slightly try to make it right, but with so many mishaps, the experience was kind of swayed. Wrong beer. Wrong burger. Dead house, long wait. No compensation on the bill for said mishaps. Maybe will try a different location or a later date. Chin up.

bMa5DHqUJhIuq8ylW8zv9g.text: I enjoyed this place. Would go again but not rushing back. Very limited menu-no appetizers...not a big deal. I expected it to be a notch below Burgatory and it was. Although, it was every bit as expensive. It was fun and it was good enough but I don't feel the need to go again soon. Service was good. Went on a Saturday and if you don't use Yelp's "no wait/get in line app" you'll be looking at an hour and a half wait by 5:30 pm. I would recommend it but not expect "gourmet burgers". Don't think of this review as negative because I don't mean it to be. It's just that the "burger bar" has been raised significantly in the last ten years and I suspect Wahlburgers wouldn't be making quite the noise that it is were it not for the name. Like I said earlier though, I'll go again because we had a nice experience overall.

0E2_ed67SQfTGQjPAnBCoQ.text: Overall it was just "ok". I know they are newly opened and there is expected to be some kinks in the flow of things for a little. So we chose to go at about 230pm on a Thursday expecting things to be slowed down a little and for the most part it appeared to be so. My biggest issue was the temperature of my burger and the inattentive service. I would have said something about the temperature of my food but the server never came back to the table. Didn't get a refill on our beverages until we were done with our food and paying the check. The fries and sweet potato tots were awesome, they came out very hot and fresh. I chose the thanksgiving day burger, it wasn't as special as it sounded in the menu. First, it was cold... like, pulled from the fridge cold. The burger advertised that it came with stuffing on the sandwich, I didn't see any underneath my clearly flattened/squashed turkey patty. Mostly just the sauces and the squash puree, it was a let down. My partner's burger (the beast) came out steaming. I was for sure jealous. The fries were my favorite part. I would be willing to go back in a few months to try something different, but I won't be making it a priority. Overall, it wasn't as good of an experience as we had expected it to be.

2AU2JFR27yrXfDS1OLcT6w.text: We were on the waiting list with no one in front of us.  When we arrived they said we would be seated next.  They seated two parties ahead of us.  After the third party was seated before us once again we decided to leave.  We were so looking forward to trying this new restaurant but,  we left extremely disappointed.

iKmtihYg22VEK2GOGpF39A.text: Juicy and flavorful burger, hot dogs were also very good.  I would order both again.  Loved the garlic mayo sauce, it's great for dipping the fries!  They also have IBC root beer which is my favorite.  Love that they support Peace Love and little Donuts.  Great service too!  Everyone is so nice.

9f-wO-pGSNcO6Dc6w9OV5g.text: Best burger in town. I've been here numerous times and has yet to disappoint. Every time with more family members. They all enjoy it. Left happy and buying merchandise because they like it so much. Highly recommended in my opinion.

qjZ7PBTQKkujtL5NzoDMyg.text: Burgers are okay not to great.  If you like liquid cheese sauce for your overpriced mac n cheese this is the place for you.  You are definitely paying for the name.  The value for what I paid was not good.  Its a nice restaurant and was clean tho.

pIuCrqllVtgPraMepdmj2w.text: Had to give this place a shot, and the food is about 4 stars I have to say. The BBQ bacon burger was rather good, the beef is obviously good quality, their BBQ sauce is home made and fantastic and with an avocado spread that makes you feel a little better for eating a burger was a nice touch. While the server was very nice, service is incredibly slow... after three rounds of drinks and 45 minutes later we had finally gotten our food and for a few burgers is just an unacceptable wait time, and when food did come they forgot my side of loaded fries. The place was also only about half way full so no excuses there. Overall food is pretty good and pretty reasonably priced, but the incredibly slow service really hurts this place. I however will give the place another shot and give it the benefit of the doubt that it was a bad day and I encourage you to give it a shot because the food is pretty good, but I warn you that this was my experience with the service.

5iHRmOl_2p61FZBX4ZRtTA.text: Service was terrible.  Burgers very small.  Onion rings are onion straws.  Thanks to the bartender working all the way down that kept noticing we needed something.  The two bartenders servicing us was to busy talking to the waiter and waitress.   A shame looked like a fun place to go.

s_dJVOf89djs_OZcSZjkMQ.text: This was the worst burger. It was greasy and tasteless. The onion rings were straws and greasy. The only good thing was the tator tots. My husband refused to eat and I ate half of the burger and it instantly made me sick to my stomach. Never will go back and do not recommend. Go to BRGR, Burgatory or Red Robin. Eat n Park super burger is way better.

tEHfeObCbnJR1au2ckCe_A.text: We came in with a party of 10 (including 3 children under 10) and waited an hour for seating -- understandable. However, we waited over an hour for 6 burgers, a salad, and three kids meals. When our food finally arrived, we were missing 2 kid meals, a burger, and a side. Therse items took another 20 min to arrive. An hour and a half for Kids meals? True, they comped the kid meals, and added desserts (which none of the kids had room for), but there was an attitude that we should not really be complaining. The food is good, but not spectacular. It's a burger joint - better than fast food but not better than other brgr places. Probably won't be back

OpK2w2pPgEzRf3iECSHktg.text: Burgers are mediocre, which would be fine if they didn't cost $10 without fries or tots. This is not a $13-$15 meal, especially when there are direct competitors in BRGR, Burgatory, and Burghers nearby that all serve excellent burgers for the same price or less.

Qta6qVkTkOpu-zn3oX6KOg.text: Loved Wahlburgers!  We went on a Wednesday night so it was not that busy so we were seated right away.  I had the Thanksgiving day sandwich and my husband had the bbq bacon burger.  We enjoyed both as well as the tater tots and mac & cheese with smoked bacon.  Delicious!   We will be back!

BvTruKDHQy9elEIhbdO0dQ.text: We went a few weeks after opening. We had two kids who can't sit still for hours (5 people total), so we came at 4 pm for an early dinner. There was still a 20 minute wait. We ordered immediately to speed up our process but our food took forever. We all ordered burgers because it's Wal BURGERS. Our order wasn't difficult, maybe a no pickle here, a no special sauce there... the order came out completely wrong. And the waitress, who was actually very nice, had no idea what we ordered. Not only was everything wrong, but she just randomly handed out the food. Some people just took bites and then realized it wasn't what they ordered. It's flu season, people! No one wants to eat off of each other! And it's expensive enough and took too long to just order another burger. You would think that they might compensate us in some way but no. Other than a quick "sorry" we got nothing! Not worth the headache. We'll go to Burgatory for our burgers from now on.

CgybJECK2b14_jRqPhdz_w.text: Ate here last night for the first time and unfortunately the last!!!  Was hoping to like it but everything was disappointing!  I see everyone on here complaining about the sides and I have to agree!!  We ordered a side of French fries (3.50) and they were awful!!  And you get about a handful if that in a paper cup!!  The drinks were all mixers with an added taste of chipotle on the rim (absolutely disgusting ).  The burger was average!!  Red robin has better burgers and unlimited fries wish they would put one in the north hills!!!  Overall too expensive!!  And not at all the quality you would expect from the Wahlburgs they should stick to making movies not burgers!!!!

YsmHRbZaZjJqYAlUp55Mbw.text: Best burger ever. Easley followed by the best server ever, Jill. Thanks for being such a pleasant person, wish all servers could be as nice as you

QaUv3MEh80wRYb__u6NPmg.text: Seasoning goes a LONG WAY... they should try it! Tasteless and bland.  The burgers from my kitchen taste better.  The hotdog my kiddo got was the best thing served! Very disappointed.  I'd compare it to McDonalds... but if I had to choose, I think I'd pick McDs!

U-xrrwB4u6jTkL78FJ-QQw.text: Just went for the first time today, had a great experience! They told us it'd be a half hour wait and they were able to seat us around 20 minutes which wasn't bad at all for how busy they were! Our server was Brie and she was wonderful. Our food came out fast and hot! And there was a ton of food for the decent prices. And most importantly the meals were delicious! Would definitely go again! I think for how new this location is/how busy they are, they really have it together.

Vbg-8NxJ6fTxwYyYqG4YNQ.text: I was pleasantly surprised with my meal at Wahlburgers!! I went with no expectations and my experience at Wahlburgers was a 10 out of 10. The food was amazing. Hamburgers are not my favorite food ... but the hamburger I had was delicious. The sides were good but not anything extraordinary. Next time, I would go get a hamburger and tots and call it good. The service was also amazing. It made my experience there that much better. I would suggest to anyone and everyone to go try Wahlburgers !

7i2EsPuSmYcj_nmxTp70Cw.text: At at the one in Vegas back in September and couldn't wait for this one to be finished. We went on a weekday at lunchtime. Being its new it was busy but we didn't wait more than 5 minutes for a table for 5! Our kids LOVED their burgers. Our server Stacy was highly knowledgeable of the menu and bar items. My husband got a beer and she was sure to keep him happy! She took our orders and checked back enough but not too much. Can't stand when servers hang out while you eat. She made my children feel very "at home" with crayons and paper to color on. Our food was brought to us in a timely manner and was absolutely DELISH!!!! Can't wait to eat here again!! Hopefully Stacy will be working again and we are lucky to sit in her section!

8CKHPwXxK15cU_rmAOl8fw.text: I took my daughter here and we ordered a BBQ burger, a black and white shake, and a caesar salad. The burger was delicious; their portions are very reasonable, which is great for me because I'm not a fan of huge, complex, packed burgers. However, the service was a huge disappointment. We went around 3:00 on a Thursday, and the place was not even close to packed. There were several tables open, and no waitlist. Our waitress seemed nice at first, until she gave us our check in the middle of our meal. My daughter still had at least 1/4 of her burger to eat, and we still had salad left. After placing the check at our table, she asked if we were done with our food. I began to question the professionalism of this waitress because it was clear we were not finished. I simply said no, and when my daughter finished her burger, the waitress was back... not even a minute later. She didn't ask if she could take the plate away; instead, she took the plate and the check and walked away without a word. I was very upset to encounter such a rude waitress. If she was in a rush to leave work, that's fine but she should've asked someone to cover her table instead of rushing my daughter and I to finish our food. Never in my life had I ever gone to a restaurant and received the check in the middle of our meal. I've eaten at places where the wait was more than 30 minutes, but the waiters and waitresses never gave me a check in the middle of our meal. I will come back for the food, but the service could really use a bit of construction.

GGE7OuX80NpNPabG7VoCaw.text: I have been to this location three times since it has open and the food and service are terrific!  If you are hungry go with the Triple Decker or the Melt.  Very tasty!!!  The onion rings (made with slivers of Red onion) are addictive and very good.  Try the Frappes (a milk shake kind of thing) - my favorite is the Creamsickle - tastes just like the frozen treat on a stick the you would get as a kid!!  Service has been excellent every time i have gone.  These servers really seem to care about getting you good food out to you fast.  I never waited for a thing.  Prices are very reasonable for the quality of food and service I received.  Definitely will be back many, many time!!

kQuJBwkssgAuuIN6N8kF4g.text: Really didn't expect to love it as much as I did. The burgers were amazing!!  We also ordered the sweet potato tater tots - again amazing!! We will definitely be back to try more on the menu!  Thanks for bringing this restaurant to the North Hills!

wDQlRWzyYOZ6s-OXyvC8Jg.text: Nothing special.   Very greasy.  Left the place and had to change and shower to get rid of the greasy smell.

VRVWzMesF_9Twf85TPEoAA.text: Ordered The Our Burger and fries.  Even though the burger was tasty and done perfectly, it was very small and not filling at all.  When I go back I will try a double or a sandwich.  On the plus side, we were seated immediately for lunch during a weekday, and the waitress was a hoot.

9K-nQJcLO2v3DvEUKVOUvg.text: The location is good, the layout inside is good, the food is good, food comes fast, menu is hard to follow.  Overall fun place

9tmZuDJhLCZC4mKjPCtvHA.text: Wow what a disapointment, I think we bought into all the hype and thought it would be great. I had the chicken sandwhich, way to salty and nothing special. My wife had the OFB and found it to rather normal. The service was very poor, we were only one of about six tables and the waitress was unatentive and rude. Had the tater tots and could have gotten a whole bag at Giant Eagle for the $3.50 they charged for one small cup, way over priced. The beer was very cold and Cosmo my wife had was very tasty.

9cEnozkUyx4r2Ts9lkoeDA.text: I am on a diet and got the salad expecting it to be covered in French fries and cheese but was pleasantly surprised that it was healthy fresh and green!! Brandon T the bar tender was great!

6exAzZGmWgoB6axf6VeiOg.text: I am giving this one star because the service was horrible. We were seated and waited 10 mins for someone to wait on us. I ordered a beer and my bf ordered a tea. We both got burgers. The waitress brought the tea out and me a water. A good 25 mins goes by... no beer is delivered. Our waitress never came back until the food was delivered. In between the time she took our order and when the food arrived, I had to ask 2 different waitresses to bring me my beer. After the food arrived, my burger had onions and I specifically said no onions. It's like this girl didn't hear a word I said when she took my order. She was not attentive at all. When it became apparent that we were not happy she stopped by 3 times AFTER we got our food to check on us probably because she knew her tip depended on it. I don't understand what she was doing the whole time because the restaurant was not busy. I was so disappointed and I wont be returning.

PxleQd5plmPnWQuQKPEjeg.text: This was my first visit to Whalburgers, and it was awesome!!!  Chloe, our server, was spectacular.  I highly recommend the sweet potato tots.  Our burgers were loaded with flavor and perfectly cooked.  Greatest place to go for a burger.

AEuFhsNfh_uVdPA6FQPF6g.text: Husband and I went to Wahlburgers this evening for dinner.  Husband ordered the Impossible Burger and thought it tasted better here than at another local restaurant that serves them.  I had the portobello sandwich and really liked it.  We sat at the bar and the bartender was great.  This is our fourth time visiting Wahlburgers and I can't wait to go back to try the Impossible Burger myself.

_UOMz8ZHezoL_LyPSn752A.text: I have no idea why the rating average is so low, this place is off the charts! The burgers were great, there's a ton to choose from both food and drink wise. I will definitely be going back!

qLBxKQNBDY0QUsUed1wFgA.text: Not impressed at all, for a burger place you would think the burger would stand out from all the other burger joints. My wife and I tried it because we liked watching the tv show. Fries were just ok not great either. Burghers in Lawrenceville was ten times better. Won't be back, sorry Marky Mark, still love you.

GptVeSqGPneLc0C1tcTm-g.text: This was an okay place. Had to wait a bit as this is the new kid in town. Thet had buzzers and some games outside in the hall. I wanted a burger, no bread. The waitress suggested a salad. Turned out it was a good suggestion. My partner had a burger. Portions were generous. While the food was nice, it was nothing exceptional. Service was good.

Qgs2jCF4k3M-kC0K8_B56w.text: Burgers are always good but it's a bit pricey. Tater tots are worth sharing! We have been there a few times now and the takeout is my favorite. They are consistent and always get our order right.

v0WKZEilVM-7W08iQCvY2A.text: So yummy! The burgers were juicy and full of flavor. My 14 year old was raving over the Our burger  The crispy haddock was just wonderful. Onion rings were amazing!  Love the Wahl Sauce. So worth the wait! Our server was lovely also! Great experience.

PY72wZwMrzHwyCjyIP3zmg.text: Burgers were average, everything is ala carte - burger, fries, drink. I would compare this to Five Guys but with a bar and table service. Wahlburgers is a sit down restaurant but drinks and fries are served in paper cups like a fast food restaurant. There are better burger joints in Pittsburgh for sure.

jOVfxHa7CDLQjgEyvakyKw.text: We had a great visit to Wahlburgers today. It was pretty crowded and a little noisy as my friends met right at lunch time. It was our first time there. The place looked clean and nicely decorated. Jill our waitress was energetic and polite and stopped by often. We ordered the onion rings basket which was yummy. This was my first time eating such thin cut onions, but they were good. I ordered the portobello mushroom sandwich which I enjoyed . The price was reasonable and I would come again. It is a nice addition to the Mccandless area ! By the way, you can enter the restaurant from either the McKnight road side or the back side. They did a great job renovating the old Northway mall with a beautiful stairwell. Check it out!

s9zqy9rFdVARSz-s4fELFg.text: Waited over an hour and a half for our good once seated. Waitress checked on us once in that timeframe, only to get another round of drinks. Never updated us on delay on food. She took an attitude when we questioned the delay and why others arriving after us were getting food before us.  Good food but service is non existent.

1SIfS_KWIOv2H0eANxKxoA.text: Tried the Our Burger and onion straws.  Very good.  Friendly service.  I would recommend if you're in the mood for a quick burger.

be-OmvE1hBivuddK8-4Ing.text: What an awesome new place!!! This was our third time at Wahlburgers. The new open seating option at the bar is really cool, as it cuts down the wait time at dinner to get in. This time, we came for lunch, and we walked right in. After starting with a cold Wahlbrewski, we moved on to our salad and Mac n cheese course. The mac n cheese was awesome! Then we went on to enjoy, of course, a one of a kind delicious burger. Our server was friendly and attentive, and food was quick! This is definitely the hottest new place to go! I would recommend it!

25g7REpMnKdsoAtKmn922w.text: The food was good but nothing special. Fries and onion straws were about the same as you can get at most places. The burger was good, but so are the ones you get at Red Robin, 5 Guys, etc. Bottom line: the place was decent, but didn't live up to the hype.

8cYY8Ky8v7VNgs9K8ulCMA.text: This place is good. I'm glad we tried it, but we probably won't return. The food is tasty but the quantity and quality are not worth the price. We did however receive fast service. 4.5 for the taste and atmosphere 3 for the price versus quantity/quality 3.5 overall Also, not included in the assessment above is 1/5 - didn't meet Mark Wahlburg.

o_Qm25cxE5IKMDzFc8mOnQ.text: This place has no business being as freaking delicious as it is!  I can't even believe a restaurant owned by the Wahlbergs is GOOD and not just a marketing scheme.  Best portabella sandwich I've ever had, and my meat eating husband - who is a total snob () says it's his favorite burger of all time.  Don't sleep on Wahlburgers!

ZodFkTRA8hFWEisVrVaTeQ.text: This was my first time trying Wahlburgers. I walked by and checked out the menu previously and liked that all of their burgers could be ordered with the impossible burger patty. We happened to be shopping in the North Hills plaza and ended up here during happy hour and they have half off appetizers and half off their Walhcoction drinks as well. I ordered a drink (cant remember the name) with rum and several juices and it was not a strong drink. I have to admit that I ordered a shot of tequila halfway through my drink to add to it. I ordered the O.F.D burger which is a half pound burger normally with Swiss and mushroom, bacon and housemaid tomato jam. Swopped out the half pound patty for an impossible burger and minus the bacon and the sandwich turned out to be pretty tasty. I really liked the tomato jam touch. I also had a side of fries. Everything was good until the check came. Normally when ordering a burger in a restaurant, fries come with it so I didn't actually think anything of it when choosing between fries and tater tots like the waitress asked. When the check came...to my surprise the burger was $13.95 ITSELF and the fries added were an ADDITIONAL $3.50. these are not specialty fries. They were a basic side of fries that were no different than making frozen fries at home. the friend I was with mentioned to the waitress next time if someone says they have never been here, maybe mention that fries are separate. I did rate this place a three because the burger was actually really good, but the value after learning that the total cost of a burger and fry was $17.45, I would have passed and just got a drink and an appetizer

photos.caption: Photo of Wahlburgers - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Wm-IL0tuO7AG_4Wgt_6eng.text: Today was my wife and my first time visiting Wahlbergers. Our waitress, Jillian G, was extremely friendly and helpful. She pointed out all of the features on the menu and was very quick to bring items to the table. It is very rare that we experience people who are so friendly and enthused at restaurants. The food came out really quick and was one of the best cups of chili and burgers I have ever had.   Thank you so much for the great experience we will definitely return!

dKt0SVl9qPOXeR6GatojcQ.text: I have wanted to eat at a Wahlburgers for years, and the Pittsburgh location did not disappoint! I had The Our Burger, sweet potato tots, Mac and Cheese, a Wahlbrewzki, and a S'mores adult frappe. Don't judge - I really wanted to try it all and I took some back to my hotel. It was all soooo delicious! I will definitely visit this location again if I am in Pittsburgh and I cannot wait to try others!

KgvB9tbAO4-PCBr29twKVQ.text: Fun place to take my nephew & his friends on a weekend night. The atmosphere was busy, friendly, and noisy. The burgers were delicious; plenty of variety of toppings, without going "too fancy" for a group of teens. At the same time, better than most burgers, as they were fresh, and cooked to order. Excellent service, fair price.

oGlKK2aS__yMuCUm7AvzMg.text: I was really looking forward to trying Wahlburgers. I didn't hear much about this restaurant, besides that it was owned by the Wahlberg's. The menu isn't large so we were able to find something quickly. I ordered the "Our Burger" which was a regular cheeseburger with their signature sauce and fries. Mike ordered the triple decker which was the same thing but three meat patties and also fries. The food was okay, it wasn't really anything that impressed us. Mike compared the fries to "concession stand fries", simple and not much salt. I guess we had higher hopes of having "gourmet burgers", but for a Sunday lunch, it was good. We went around 1:30 and it was a 30-45 minute wait. I definitely suggest using the Yelp Waitlist prior to going.

unO5pkCAsgavQoydRoDY7Q.text: This is a typical modern day hipster chain with small portions and large prices.  I ordered fries, the chili-cheese dog and the burger.   - The hot dog was sent back as soon as I got it. They don't use buns, they use more traditional loaf style bred. It's not very strong. I couldn't pick up my hot dog because it was just covered in toppings and when I did, it poured out all over the place and self-destructed. I had to get a new one. The dog is a beef style dog, which I don't really like as I prefer pork.  - The burger was really small which is fine but not fine for the price, but McDonald's is the same size and half the price. I make better burgers at home. Nothing special.  - The fries were fine and nothing special, but it's hard to mess up fries.  The price was too much for what they gave you and the quality was just not there.   The seating are these bright green hard plastic/metal chairs which aren't comfortable at all.  In the end, this place was a lot like Burger 21 which was right across the street and didn't make it. I don't drink, but I don't really see why you would go here for a burger when the North Park Longue or J-Clarks is up the street and if you have to go to a chain, Chili's is better.  This will not make my rotation of restaurants and this was my first and last trip there. If it didn't have a name and a TV show, it would probably already be closed, because the quality and pricing just isn't there.

photos.caption: Photo of Wahlburgers - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hot dog Explosion!

VndiKyMxOduTjoEpYldtuQ.text: Always good food and pleasant service. Their pickles are oh so yummy. I can't wait for the new Robinson location to open.

c9mn6mgqUbiuJhzFsUNkHw.text: I had to check this place out as I'm a huge Wahlberg fan and a huge burger fan - I mean, who isn't?   I was a little disappointed with the burgers just because the place was really hyped up when it first opened. The burgers are really greasy and I that's not how I love my burgers. However, the onion"rings" which are more like thin onion strings, were really good!  On the upside, Wahlburgers uses the No Wait app, and since it gets pretty busy and wait time can be more than an hour, that's a huge up. I love the atmosphere inside - especially if you're a fan of Mark, Donnie and Paul! Service was quick and concise, too.  My biggest complaint, overall, is that we were seated near the kitchen and when I put my clothes that I wore to dinner in my llaundry hamper, my ENTIRE closet smelled like Wahlburgers the next morning and I couldn't have washed my clothes fast enough. I'm sure that stems from the frying grease - as I said, my burger was pretty greasy.   Wahlburgers is a one time visit for me - cool atmosphere, sweet to say you've been but I'll be hurrying to another burger joint next time I'm craving a patty between a bun.

gFGPLktelMl97JwruRTBfw.text: A huge hamburger fan as well as Wahlburg fan.. was so excited to visit the new restaurant that opened in the North Hills area of Pittsburgh.   They do not accept reservations so my first trip was on a week day  - hoping to beat the crowd.  It wasn't as bad as I expected.   The area where the restaurant is - the mall has completely been revamped... and guessing this restaurant was opened here to attract more businesses to the local stores/area.  I just found it odd of all places for Walburgs is in the North Hills - not downtown or southside etc.  BUT!!!!  I am all for more jobs and do like to see other areas of the Burg thrive.  There is a small bar (about 10 bar stools) you can grab a drink or eat at.  The dining room consists of tables mostly - only a few booths.   I thought it would be bigger in size but it was just right. There is also an outside balcony with outside seating.  So we only had to wait about 15 minutes for a table (Thursday 5 pm).  I expected to wait longer. I like the fact that my table status was sent to me via text msg through yelp!   Seated at our booth ...  service was good.  We had studied the menu so we knew what we wanted.  I of course wanted to try several menu items.  The mac n cheese with bacon ...$3.50 and worth it but folks its on the borderline of the sharing size.   It was good and very flavorful and no doubt one of our favorite parts of the meal.  The tater tots (regular not yams!) We were excited about this menu item but when they arrived..  they looked like frozen tater tots!?   I could have bought two bags for $3.50 at the grocery store. They were bland and a disappointment.  We tried dipping them into the walburg sauce and that sauce was ok - a bit odd. Seemed like mayonnaise and ketchup? Then the fries.. ok so they weren't fresh cut but were definitely better than the tots.   The onion rings..  we were sold when we saw they were "house made"  .. and if you are a lover of onion rings.. its so fun to dip but when these arrived.. they looked like deep fried onions straws that belong on a burger? They were tough to eat and so odd.  I get it.... It's a different twist on the popular fried food - but was also a disappointment.  Basic tossed salad..dressing on the side - ranch - was requested. The salad came and it was accompanied with the ranch dressing but it was already dressed with a vinaigrette dressing?    Ok mis-haps happen. It was obviously someone elses salad.. another server put it back that way or something? It was just odd.   Then the burgers arrived.  I loved mine.  It lived up to my expectations.  The atmosphere was cool but the food was lacking.   My boyfriend was so excited that there were cupcakes on the menu and when we inquired about those.. were told that they didnt have cupcakes but donuts?? Donuts for dessert? Ugh I will pass.   We had to ask for silverware? Why weren't they on table or provided when we were seated?  It was disappointing.  Myself and my party were not impressed. The prices weren't too bad but it was one thing after the next.  Perhaps the restaurant is just experiencing growing pains.

4EcyzTEhC7FyDYlTx4G31Q.text: I've got to start by saying that I was so thankful to check the Yelp app before heading over for burgers. It was late lunch on Saturday, and the app let me know that the wait would be well over an hour. Luckily I was able to reserve a spot on the wait list before I left my house. We checked in person with five parties ahead of us and were seated within 20 minutes.  The restaurant is smaller than I would've imagined it being. However they made up for it with the prices. Things capped at about $10, which seems like a rarity these days at nicer burger joints. The cheeseburger I got, which came with pretty amazing sweet potato tots, cost about 7 bucks. Everything was tasty and good.  So, was this a meal worth a two-hour wait, like some groups I saw outside? Hell no. But it was a good inexpensive meal, and hopefully a place I'd go to again once the hype dies down a bit.  Also, it wasn't until afterward that I saw they have a black and white milkshake, but that's on my list for next time.

1snA4f0JOObMuJybBfR2YQ.text: Attempted to come here when they first opened and was told there was an hour and a half wait on a Thursday afternoon. Tried again a few months later on a Friday at 6:00 and there was no wait and no crowd at all. Burger was average, wasn't a fan of the fries or the crumb topping on the Mac n cheese. Good service. Excellent happy hour specials!

EKT4mb4pPs-jqPDuCfRARA.text: I went there hyped expecting great food as lots of hype was surrounding the opening and among my group of friends, my gorgeous galpal and me went for a lovely little date, from the sounds of the menu I was excited then came the miserable server from hell and the over rated food... I ordered the triple burger and add bacon, she ordered some kind of fiesta burger, we also ordered fries and onion rings as sides and an appetizer of fried pickles...waitress came back and told us that there were no pickles left okay, then for the next 10 mins we tried to get her attention to order the buffalo chicken dip, we finally got it after watching her almost blow a gasket after having a bad day presumably, and just giving us dirty looks, but her i can tolerate some lousy service if the food is kick ass...it wasn't... the regular pickles were awful, the buffalo chicken dip tasted like quaso cheese with spicy chicken, no cream cheese and super greasy big let down, the fries were worse than most frozen fries i have had, ore ida makes better frozen fries, the fries were dry bland and not flavorful; the onion rings weren't onion rings but onion straw that are typically on sandwiches, which is fine they were good but they weren't onion rings... the milkshake was delicious, and here comes the burger...it was good...but it wasn't nothing i would go out of my way for, average burger comparable to a smash burger or a five guys burger... very overrated place i wouldn't recommend it and wouldn't go outta my way to eat here, price for the food was about 40 dollars kinda pricy for two burgers and a appetizer, having to pay separate for the fries and onion rings instead of being included with the sandwich upped the price a good bit and cost almost 15 bucks per meal, and it just wasn't that good, would def recommend five guys over this or hell Red Robin Atleast u get unlimited Fries that are good and they have the delish strawberry lemonade:)

MjHUxSjHjWKf8IfKZ5SqSQ.text: So I'm assuming that this was only the "Soft" opening.  So let me start here, we were seated a table ASAP. A waiter came over to explain the menu to us. But then proceeded to let us know he was not our actual server and that she would be over soon.   Our waiter who's name was Keirston did not really know the menu yet. Which is fine because everything is still new. She asked if we wanted any drinks (we placed those orders) Waters with lemons, Red Sangria, White Sangria, and 2 beers. The drinks came out fairly quick. Next she asked us what we wanted.   Orders: I ordered A "triple burger with no cheese" it was supposed to come with lettuce, cheese, onion, pickle and "wahlsauce". My Burger came out just with the patty and bread. NOTHING ELSE. My sister ordered a double decker burger with everything on it. And a side of Mac N cheese. They forgot to serve her Mac N Cheese. And after she received her order they never gave her a fork to eat with, Even after reminding her!  The other meals consist of 3 double decker burgers with everything on them. With a side of fries and tots. Their meals came out as is.  Our meal took about 1:30 to come to our table. Even had to ask how long it would be, receiving "it should be on its way".  I thought this was very inappropriate. They were only making BURGERS !!   After all was said and done. My total was under $30.00 and my card was charged $66.00!!  I will not be returning here.

Kl86W0QZ3Xsfr0GdrLuWmg.text: I really enjoy coming here! Every time we have gone here it has been busy, but they are on No Wait so we have never had to wait for more than 10 minutes before being seated! I always order the Our Burger, and it is delicious! The coffee milkshake is also super good. Looking forward to eating here again soon.

Y-DVxawNXF7t_yFR4jIimA.text: Stopped here for a bite to eat before shopping.  This location had just opened so it was packed.  Two hour wait to be seated but the bar was open seating.  We grabbed two spots & waited patiently because they were so slammed.  We both ordered the Our Burgers.  I topped mine with bacon & avocado spread in addition to the regular toppings. I also ordered a side of Yukon gold fries. The garlic mayo mustard dip was delicious. It's one if the many sauces/dressings available.  The food was good. It was along the lines of Five Guys or Red Robin.  Service was pretty good considering the amount of people that the staff was waiting on.  Loved the decor.

y8w0kTpPV0mKtdmYNy8yvw.text: Best burger in the Pittsburgh area bar none. Fresh, simple, clean, fast, and relatively well priced.

inTfbLXSOqa9Z5UMcEW5nQ.text: Very average food. There are so many good places to get a burger in Pittsburgh I would skip on this one.

DqMMcs8L6UHDvJqC-WOYbQ.text: I'm not going to lie, I had some pretty high expectations for this restaurant that were not fulfilled. My mom and I arrived around 3:50 this afternoon and there was a 5 minute wait (which wasn't bad). They do not have their no wait app set up yet so you can put your place in line before arriving. While we were standing there we noticed it was getting pretty busy and people's wait times went up to 45 minutes. Everyone seems pretty hyped up to try this place. We were seated in a booth and greeted by our waitress Chloe fairly quick. She was very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. She was also very good with making recommendations which I always enjoy when I go out to a new restaurant. I'm going to be honest, the employees and friendly service is all this place has going for it in my opinion. Kind, friendly service that makes you feel welcomed goes a long way in the food industry. She was very attentive and deserves to be recognized for that.   The burgers though, they didn't win me over. In fact, they left me wanting to hurl over instead. I ordered the BBQ bacon burger and it was greasy. It comes with 1/3 lb burger, jalapeno, white cheddar, bacon, House made bbq sauce and avocado spread. I asked that they didn't include the jalapeno on my burger, but they also left off the avocado spread sadly. The bbq sauce was pretty good, but the burger itself was too greasy and not very thick. I have definitely had better burgers elsewhere. I hate to say it but it's almost like having a burger at a place like Steak 'n Shake. The tater tots were pretty subpar. Unfortunately, I wouldn't come running back here if I was in the mood for a burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Wahlburgers - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

WUGlgdTdgWfGGRlQ_ok_pQ.text: Eh. Long wait but that was to be expected since it is new. Server took awhile to great us. She was nice enough though. Food was mediocre at best. Didn't realize plastic cups are a thing beyond fast food. Husband didn't enjoy either. I guess that's a thing with celebrity owned places they just rely on the name to keep them in business.

pWTwHLbp8Sh1CufqpxY88g.text: A great place that does live up to the hype!!  Great food with some special Pittsburgh touches!  The burgers are amazing!  The Sloppy Joe is great and takes you back to old fashioned sloppy joes!!  Mac and cheese, amazing!!  The staff is pleasant and helpful!!  Been here at different times of the day and always a good experience. The only thing I would change are the chairs. Not the most comfortable but the good food makes up for it!!

-G2M9RC8j-hK90Pjc8AGmg.text: We were out in the shopping center and figured we haven't tried Wahlburgers, so why not eat there? I was underwhelmed to say the least. The burgers were standard and to me nothing special. You do not get a side dish with your burger either, which is kind of annoying. Raise the price a buck or two and include fries or tots. Up charge the other sides. I found my burger greasier than I'd prefer and eating from a basket just isn't for me. Also the sides came in paper cups, which seems wasteful. Honestly we probably won't be back.

SVbGoOr2VRIZSeX-Jd4KZw.text: So I had mixed expectations. But I have been pleasantly surprised!  Not only affordable for a date night but I got Jenns walhbowl and I have never had a salad with this quality of lettuce. The chicken was amazing. Everything was amazing. I LOVED my dinner and my husband and I will return!!

y9ottlfMe_O0s5ZaGi8VCA.text: For my first time, it was a pretty decent experience. Other than the pretty cold "welcome" (um, can I get someone to seat me?? Why are staff looking confused?) I enjoyed Wahlburgers. The waitress, Chole was mad cool and the food was delicious! I had the sloppy joe. It was very filling and I wish I would've saved some for lunch the next day. The sloppy joe is a bit sweet, so I love the pickles they give you on the side. Nice balance of taste. The only thing that would've made it better was an extra slice of bread. My daughter had the vegan sandwich. I think it's called the Impossible Burger or something. She loved it, especially with the special Wahlburger sauce. As a side we shared fries. For $3.50 or so a side, I wasn't buying two, but the one was enough for the both of us. We topped it all off with double chocolate cupcakes that we weren't able to eat since we were full. There are some other items I'd like to try, so I will be back!   It was a clean establishment, the bathrooms were decent and we went on a Monday evening and it  wasn't busy. The overall service and experience, on a scale of 1-10, was a 8.

3Cc5kZb9xj5zS6-Yg-Kl6g.text: Amazing burgers and always great service! I always get Donnie's favorite the BBQ burger with avocado, never disappoints!

9OS83mt5XmKmiUB0XUPGFw.text: The burger I had as a whole was good except the meat didn't taste like it had had any seasoning added to it. I ordered the side of onion rings and it became obvious that the oil wasn't hot enough, as they had soaked up so much oil I began to feel a little sick at the end of my meal.  The overall feeling of the restaurant felt ok but the acoustics was a bit too overwhelming. I would give it another try as I might of gone in on a bad night, but not a great first impression.

MAYkdyqSqz_I5X-s-aQWhA.text: Good food thought portion size was alittle better service is what helps. Plave was crowed and good prices also.

u-RGmvPcEPOwrnd9_qbD9Q.text: I was really excited to try out the Wahlburgers restaurant. There beer selection was ok. They had Dog Fish 60 mins, which I love. They also had a local brewery (East End) which I like but the beer they decided have on tap was not my favorite (an Ale).  Anyway, I ordered the BBQ Bacon burger. It was just ok! That is troubling because (1) the burger was around $10, (2) it did not come with fries, (3) I didn't taste any BBQ sauce, and (4) the description mentioned jalapenos and there was only one on the burger.  This place is a big DISAPPOINTMENT. It's on the same level as Applebees.

o7baVnSseOL5-StJmE8VqQ.text: I'm not going to lie I love this place and the food and mostly The service but I ordered a lemonade once and it tasted like it was sitting in the sun for 5 months I told the waitress and I got a new drink but she still charged me for it I only took a sip and spit it out immediately... other then that experience it would be a five star.

8jk5sBykDrIaXUnW_kpe7w.text: Always crazy busy. I think the food is good but doesn't live up to the hype or the price. I'd rather go to Burgatory down the road.

uj5I4QJmEjWcTJIJGs4wPQ.text: Only reason people go there is to hope to see the owners. Only went because the school was having a fund raiser. Sorry fans of the owners not of having a heart attack from the food. One start for their generosity.

woBW2Cm45pPQt0TVxMPlMA.text: Came in for the first time and it was pretty much what I expected. The bacon blitz burger was good but quickly fell apart into many pieces forcing me to use a fork to eat a good portion of my burger. The sweet potato fries were good as well, and the pierogie burger looked great even though I didn't try it myself.  It's the kind of place that I'd be willing to eat again but not really a place I'd go out of my way to eat at a second time- the same as any chain restaurant in a city with so many good dining options

72raXOIZuQK3SPXi5LYktQ.text: The burger I had was the greatest burger I have had I a long while. Definitely worth the calories, and the best service I have had in a long while as well. Jillian G, our waitress was the best!! When we go back I will ask for her.  The burger I had was the Melt, and had Alma's macaroni salad... YUM! And you must try the sweet potato tots! Thank you Wahlburgers!

mMVocicKjNBfHM3Llfi_2w.text: The waitress we had tonight gave us the worst service we've ever received from anyone. She treated us as if we were an imposition on her time. I had to speak to the manager once during the meal because we asked her for sauce and it took her almost ten minutes to get us 'prepackaged' sauce. Then when she gave us our check, she then went to the front to have a long chat with the hostess and we waited almost 20 minutes before getting up to go to the front and pay for our meal. As we were walking to the front the same waitress passed me, twice, and completely ignored me. I then told my husband to go get her tip from the table and asked the hostess to process my bill. The hostess then went over to the waitress, in front of me, and told the waitress I wasn't giving her a tip and they both started laughing about it. The waitress then came and slammed the bill with my credit card in front of me and said in a nasty tone," Have a nice night!" and stalked off. I then told her to get the manager and advised her on her rude and disgusting behaviors/customer service. She then walked over to the bar, where the manager was making a drink, and she advised that a customer wanted to see him. He asked her why and she stated ," oh I was rude to her". They then joked about it, in front of me and my family, and she walked away. The manager came over to us and apologized for the waitresses behavior,  but after all of the above I was disgusted. I really hope to talk to a general manager, or possibly one of the Wahlburgers to find out why these behaviors are tolerated and encouraged amongst the staff.

VWifRJh9uEFI8RiunyhsAg.text: Bleh. Frozen, overpriced, hamburgers. Went here once and when it's mentioned in conversation, I say it's a no go. Sides were ok. Save your money and go to brgr or Burgatory instead. Do not recommend.

uiUDeuidJ90Kv_rxZMSX9Q.text: Second visit. Great happy hour prices. 8 us seated promptly and service was exc. Thank you Stacey!

REKZVNSG3JeDMJEFdopUUA.text: Honestly, I'm in love with this place. I just recently went gluten and dairy free, so I'm highly restricted when eating out. Especially because of cross contamination. However, wahlburgers, and the amazing place it is, has gluten free buns and cooks their fried items in a separate fryer for patrons that are gluten free. What more could you ask for??? I felt as though the service was incredible and the waitress truly worked with me to find what would be ok for my dietary restrictions. Everyone was friendly and helpful. If I could give this place 10 stars, I would. My food was also insanely good. I loved my turkey burger. And the bun was great too even though it was gluten free! Go here!

v7VM6wwUoqv-Dfd-45DSuA.text: Great casual spot for a low-key burger and fries meal! I enjoyed my meal here. Wahlburgers offers a quality meal and adequate service relative to the price. I'm not sure why others have given this spot low reviews. This is simply a fun, affordable, casual cheeseburger spot - its just not a gourmet or speciality burger spot.  Atmosphere is clean and casual. Service was friendly. Walhburgers surprisingly offers a diverse menu with lots to choose from. Food was definitely enjoyable, what I expected for the price.  I was only disappointed that they did not have onion rings at 6 on a saturday night :( I really wanted to indulge in those.
