Photo of Wahlburgers - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. cheeseburger
Photo of Wahlburgers - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. cheeseburger

6UTorORRwfaDNauwxc0U9w.text: It would be easy for me to not like this place... The sheer amount of Wahlberg photos, quotes and family history is enough to make you a little nauteous. But I was here to try a burger. Thankfully on a Sunday night where the restaurant was fairly empty and we were able to sit outside.  The service was fast. Our waitress was friendly. And the food? It was way better than expected and they set their bar high for my first visit.   I went with the standard burger but swapped out raw onion for carmelized onions (major win). They don't ask your cooking preference, but mine was a perfect medium and plenty juicy. Not a huge burger, which I consider a major plus. It had a nice house sauce, fresh tomatoes and pickles. The lettuce was a major waste as they used shredded romaine? It ended up somewhat wilted and didn't have much use (iceburg would be a huge improvement).  The tater tots and fried pickles were both satisfying sides and I really enjoyed their homemade lemonade, and the fact they didn't charge for a refill like I was expecting.  For dessert we only had one cupcake option which was the plain vanilla with cream cheese icing. Not too sweet which my molars were thankful for.  Campiness aside of the name, the reality show and all the press - it was a good meal, and I'd take it over Burgatory. It was only one visit though, so let's see if they can keep it up.

Ohz_cjvjJVAchC1Dw7s3Bw.text: Impressed by the food, not impressed that fries are separate, I need my carbs without the extra $$$.  Also not impressed that Marky Marky and the funky bunch isn't playing throughout. Bathrooms were very clean, the service was great. If you plan on bringing the kiddos, go for it but leave the stroller behind, it's a tight squeeze.

aRcNG3P_k68i8s8R8_bLww.text: Yummy burgers and the loaded tots are my new favorite. Also excellent service and love all the outside seating.

f6ZTxFGs1FBrd-ZYdzn9cQ.text: I would just like to take a moment to thank the Wahlburger brothers for creating some bomb burgers! My boyfriend and I went here recently for a little last minute date night and we got a couple fantastic burgers. The atmosphere when you first walk in is so colorful and makes you ready to sit down and watch a game over a beer and a burger. I ordered a double stacked burger with cheese, bacon, pickles, lettuce, tomato, mayo, ketchup, and mustard. Pretty plain Jane, but damn was it good. Definitely set the bar high for burgers for me. The fries were phenomenal as well. Our server gave us a side of their special sauce they make here, which was amazing! Whatever that sauce was, I'd love to buy a bottle of it and use it on all my fries in the future. On a side note, this place makes their own pickles too. Which is so cool, and they were to die for, especially if you're a pickle lover like me. I even got extra pickles on the side and ate every single one. Our server also talked me into getting a frappe, which is a fancy word for milkshake, and this milkshake was one of the best things I've ever put in my mouth. (And that's saying something.) She made it perfect. She told me she used some extra chocolate syrup and threw some crushed Oreos in it. My god, I felt so naughty eating that bad boy. She was so nice too, she gave us the whole run down as soon as we sat down about the specials going on, and about everything on the menu. She did inform us that their happy hour drinks are so cheap. Happy hour drinks are half price than the normal menu price, something to keep in mind there. This place is super affordable too, for my boyfriend and I to both get burgers, fries and drinks, it was a total of $39 and some change. Nothing beats great food, great servers, and a great price. The 3 elements to a perfect restaurant if you ask me.  I honestly have no complaints about this place, my boyfriend and I are taking all our family and friends out to Wahlburgers very soon so they can all experience their next level creations. Can't wait to come back!

s4EYH8nZ5p_GZFLX4mUMbg.text: Lots of different burger choices. The service is always prompt and attentive. The Cornhole set right outside is a nice way to keep the kids occupied

a09H8S9wiV8nvbcER1HbSQ.text: Stop in for a burger. The place is clean and the staff was friendly. Service was awesome! The food was delicious, and the price was fair.

My3ygQTyQ8fKMVDzLL1EiQ.text: We arrived during happy hour with 3 kiddos under 11.  The two moms needing Gin and Tonics.  Luckily we hit the Gin and Tonic Mother Load.  I had the Pittsburgh G&T and Rochelle has the  Cucumber.  Very generous pour! Our server was quite gracious and patient even cleaning up the obligatory kid spill right away! Impossible Burger? Great!  OFD burger? Great!  Sweet potato tots? Great! If we didn't live in California, we'd be regulars.

cJSAWbbLy_R0ZUYl8qOyWw.text: I don't know why but I didn't have high expectations coming into this place.  I'm glad to say that it definitely proved me wrong.  I ended up getting the fiesta burger with sweet potato tater tots.  The burger was seriously delicious.  It was a bit spicy, just the way I like it.  The tots were perfectly cooked and they give you a solid portion.  Overall, this place has great food at a good value and I'll definitely be back.

yNIBb1Cl4FDYOF63Pgxtrg.text: I need to start by saying... I love NKOTB & Wahlburgers so I didn't expect to dislike it !!!! :) I was sooooo excited to give this place a try. I've heard they can have a sizable  wait so we chose to go around 2 on a Saturday afternoon and were seated immediately!   The atmosphere is bright (they offer outdoor seating but it was still too chilly) and everyone we dealt with was extremely friendly and offered their suggestions as far as the menu!   I ordered the BBQ Bacon (Donnie's fav, which it indicates next to all three brothers) and it was delicious! I don't usually order a burger when I'm out to eat, but this one was made perfectly and very good!! I got sweet potato tots which were YUM (who doesn't love tots?) and my bf tried the French fries which they recommend dipping in their Wahl sauce... wow! That stuff is addicting and GOOD.   Yes, it's a little touristy and people may doubt the food... but to me, the quality, price, and atmosphere was all great! We'll be back ! :)

zz0ZnUBfLjbDYFeMUDONCQ.text: Ordered the OUR burger with no tomato and added bacon. Took a few bites and realized no onion or bacon, and a huge hunk of tomato on it. Wasn't in the mood with having to deal with to get them to refire my order. Bun was over buttered. Tots were nothing to write home about and not that hot. Usually I am that crazy person that loves ALL sauces, but not today. I could just barely stand the wahl sauce or the house made bbq sauce. Server was friendly...despite totally whiffing on my burger order. I was so hungry walking in and left without even finishing my meal. Oh well...overall disappointed.

qn4t3hhD0EMNWcw8oFlwWw.text: Service was great, the Paul's favorite burger was just ok, Mark's Turkey Burger in my opinion probably the best thing on the menu. Lots of better choices for burgers in Pittsburgh, especially for the wait times on the weekends.

l7yfIU3rktytoUHbXYyIkw.text: The food is great and we didn't mind the wait to be seated, but the wait time for your food was a bit long.... 30 minute wait for burgers? And server was not too friendly or helpful.  Also ... be prepared to have all your clothes smell of burgers and onions! Wahlburgers should hand out free dry cleaning coupons with their receipt. There has to be a ventilation issue as the entire mall smells of it. And I mean REALLY SMELLS of it.  Thinking we will wait until summer to go back and sit out on their outside deck to spare us from the stink.  Low stars for atmosphere and service.  Wish I could give 5 because the food was so good.

eolcCnyuBTAXWaBYVu-z-Q.text: Marking another one off my list at The Block. I was worried going here on a Sunday night at 5:30 would be a bad idea but there wasn't a wait at all. Regardless, I decided to just sit at the bar to watch the Kansas/Duke game.  It was seat yourself and had 4 decent sized TVs.   The bartender Brendan was awesome. Friendly, informative and made you feel right at home. Everything you'd want.  I decided to try a Wahlbrewski because why not!  It was okay and that's about it.  Pretty standard.  As far as food, I really wanted that Double Decker Hotdog the very first reviewer had but was told there was no such thing. Even when I showed the pic I was told someone must have messed up...oh well!  Much like that reviewer, I have rarely seen a Sloppy Joe on a restaurant menu so I had to give it a go along with a side of Sweet Potato Tots.  Best decision of my day!  The portions were huge and I was beyond full when I left. High marks for the Homemade Wahl Sauce, Cheese Sauce and Dill Pickles! I'd order a side of Pickles next time on their own that's how good they were.  The Sweet Potato Tots are a great choice to compliment any dish and the Sloppy Joe itself was a perfect open faced sandwich with just enough mix of what your Mom would make and how a unique chef would fix it.  Try it out!  The prices are a bit high in my opinion, $8.95 for the Sandwich, $3.50 for the Tots and $6 for the Beer.  I'd like to see a side come with the sandwich but to their credit, the side was enough for at least two people. There had to be 50 Tots in there.  Overall, I liked it a lot. Between the friendly atmosphere and service I received and how much I enjoyed the food I ordered, I'll be back to explore more of the menu.

CfwYmiJsTvORM089zAXeeA.text: The Mac & cheese with bacon add chicken was super dry and pretty inedible. Good thing the dog will eat practically anything     Dad's chili was pretty bland but the burgers and the deep fried pickles were AMAZING!!

mXu5-mgNZmR3pE9X8yiIaQ.text: First off Vegetarian yelping friends They have the impossible burger! I was in the mood for a hearty burger often a challenge for a vegetarian I had heard seen the sign for Wahlburgers on McKnight saw such mixed yelp reviews but figured might as well give it a try.  It's in a mall The mall was closed I almost left there were no cars in the lot..but looking up I see Wahlburgers all lit up and their outside porch TVs were on So I head in take the elevator up...and there is Wahlburgers  Warmly greeted I sit in a booth Instantly my friendly waitress is there to help me I explain I'm here for that impossible burger she assures me I will love it As I'm waiting I'm brought a yum little cup cake with green sprinkles Then some sweet potato tots omg are they yum They taste sort of maplely.  Waitress made me a cherry coke float a perfect side to my burger  And let me tell you about my burger I tweaked it's original menu suggestion  So mine has American cheese lettuce tomato and their burger sauce The burger was So good  The atmosphere is casual there was a tv showing Wahlburger info it's cute And there was a tv with Baseball on All the chairs are green so maybe Donnie's fav color is green? Great service yum food this burger place is an easy five stars. I'll be back for sure

7JVAkChfZFbU9TwMHaohgg.text: I wanted to try Wahlburgers for the obvious reasons...the celeb owners and TV show. It did not disappoint! The prices are so reasonable...$8 for a decent burger. Burgers, fries, tots, onion rings, Mac n cheese were all delicious! Def try the sauces...wahl sauce and Jens sauce both had great flavor. The service was wonderful, waitress was super friendly! We got our food pretty quick which was a plus. I put our name on the waitlist through the yelp app before we arrived so we only had to wait about 10 minutes once we got there. Oh and get a cupcake, one of the best cupcakes I've had. All in all, I was impressed and will def go back.

UMriE4kQkabFY8mbSCB6FA.text: So not impressed with Walburgers, and I had such high hopes it's so expensive and everything is separate. I got the fiesta with the turkey burger and it was so average I could of went to steak and shake for almost the same thing and it's 3 times less in price. Got an adult frappe and it was blah and my daughter liked the hot dog but not the fries and my mom got the chicken salad and it wasn't worth it at all. Won't be coming back.

4nUQE5TDbWWIQryqcTZQSg.text: Yummy!! Great waitress!! Enjoyed the bacon Mac n cheese. My husband got the Our Burger. Incredibly good. Ended the dinner with the adult hot fudge sundae. Ok. Delicious!!!

8UC09jcfgeLVgDz5MMLM7g.text: Amazing!  Burgers are delicious, Mac n cheese is the best ever!!! . Fast service, great atmosphere.  Only thing missing was Donnie!

eEutiF2T6yWzd024d8f7XA.text: Had lunch here yesterday. Service was very good. Our waterless was very good and even noticed my order was wrong before I noticed she had it corrected immediately. As for the food it was tasty and large portions. I had a Cobb salad  my wife had a bbq hamburger salad. We split an order of onion straws that was more than enough for two. The only thing I did not like was the silverware it was one step up from plastic. We sat out on the terrace. Nice weather very pleasant. Would recommend trying it sometime

KNwz3HtSfgXw3gkhYU-0rA.text: Good food, a little pricey only because you have to buy everything individually, like fries don't come with burgers

AmumWPF1nF8ucsN396poFg.text: We visited twice and both times it was just ok.  Nothing very special or memorable.  I was expecting more.  Sweet potato tots were tasty if you like those.  I really don't understand all the buzz?

9dHDaz1doBBaAi75hsHiDg.text: This is a great spot for a casual lunch or dinner.  We avoided a hour-ish wait by checking making a reservation on Yelp beforehand, which really helped the overall experience.  The location was smaller than I had expected, but we were seated within a few minutes.  The burgers are very nice sized - a burger and a shared order of sweet potato tots were enough to leave my wife and I stuffed.  I got the OFD, and really enjoyed the burger.  The meat was well seasoned and the tomato jam was amazing.  I got the jam on the side, and it made a perfect dipping sauce for the tots.  The prices are great, and the burger stacks up well against many of the higher priced burgers I've had throughout the city.  Go in with realistic expectations, and you won't be disappointed.  This is a great casual burger in an convenient location with a price that's tough to beat.

Wc7kk5c398qwh-63NYT0eQ.text: Would give this 3.5 stars if i could. The service was pretty good, friendly staff. The bathroom was dirty, I expected a little more to start with that. Overall, the burgers were good, but not awesome. The fries were thick, and pretty plain. The sweet potato tots were average. Altogether, everything was good but probably not something I would come back specifically to seek out and eat. Nothing on the menu jumped out and said HEY this looks great! I had the BBQ bacon burger. It was on the smaller side, but the avocado spread was a nice addition. My husband got the fiesta burger. The meat was good and quality just not packed well and falling apart in his hand. The prices seem to lineup with any other burger place, since the sides are separate, it still evens out to be the same price as burgatory. I had low expectations going in, and it didn't really exceed them.. if you want to say you went here just because then this is the place for you.

Cw8I9XSwUHbOHwYwsu8RXQ.text: Good food but service was horrible. Overall it would be about two to three stars at best. The menu options was ok. The burger good but the sides not so good. Mac and cheese was lacking flavor. Frys ok not very good. Hard and overlooked. Service bad. Not to busy and can see why. Skip and go to five guys.

tf5Cpasl23rRIH-l_Z3FLA.text: My second time here. Burgers and service was good. Apps not so much. Just skip the apps and eat the burgers.

W5dC_kT38XXfzTmw9JZx5g.text: Great burgers (get the Paul sauce)  and a nice homemade macaroni salad. Finish it with a cupcake.

pgXhtnYgQ4CbAEol2jJwQA.text: Went for lunch and was pleasantly surprised. Had the fried pickles and sweet potato tots. The bbq bacon cheese burger was delicious and had a kick.

o7kEaQ-gnUGesYnhlz6n7Q.text: Very disappointed food was below average  Service was great (only reason for 2 stars) Burger = below average  Hot dog = awful Milk shake = McDonald's  This place will not last long not even in same category as Burgatory I would put it below steak n shake and 5 Guys way below them

sq-QRvNZERoNCPggwn4cFg.text: My husband and our 2 kids went there. We love that they use the no wait app. All of their food was amazing and reasonably priced, good portions. My husband had a double cheeseburger and it was super cheesy. I had the grilled chicken sandwich with onions and it was very tasty as well. The sides are good portions. My son had the Mac n cheese and it was SO good! We will be going back.

8-OrgGOXZJ5auYK2qix_tg.text: First-highly suggest you check the wait list, and join before going during peak times. We were lucky to grab a table at the bar, and bypassed the hour+ wait.   My daughter and niece proclaimed the burgers to be the "best they've ever had", and judging by the lack of leftovers-they were correct!  I've heard others complain about poor and/or slow service--we had the direct opposite. I highly recommend you try to get "Jillian" as your server! She was prompt, and super friendly! The best!

pkL5uFiN1_I4_JLW9MrBvQ.text: Food was good. I was hoping to have the pierogi smash burger that was shown on the television show but it was not on the menu. I was so disappointed not to have the combination of Pittsburgh with a Wahlburgers burger. I then settled for the original melt and a side of tots. Both items were delicious. The atmosphere is okay.. the restaurant is in a section where it is alone. There is spots for shops just not current businesses so when you enter on the bottom floor of the building is feels somewhat abandoned. You can tell that the area is in the processes of revitalized so I'm sure it will be better when more businesses open.

6pP1149LrpzxI84NeRqC1g.text: I'm not sure how you make a burger taste like nothing. I don't mean lack of seasoning, but nothing. Not beef. Not meat. It was like chewing on a dry, flavorless disk of sadness and broken promises. I've had better dining experiences at a high school football game. Service was pretty good. Friendly. Attentive. Food needs some work.

SJRw1S8jH_bmnsAyR5M-rA.text: Had the Our Burger. It was ok, nothing special.  It comes with zero sides, ordered a side of fries, they were ok.  The draft list only had 5 items.  Overall the portions are small, the food is fair and the decor reminds you of a McDonalds.  I'll not be back.

acEnKSwAgI2D1615uZUYcA.text: Boy was I disappointed in this restaurant. I was looking forward to going because it was new and everyone was talking about it. So I go with my girlfriend and her family, and we order an appetizer of wings, and it took over 20 minutes for them to be brought out, on a day where the restaurant was only half full, and they screwed up the flavor of the wings. Then, they screwed up my girflriends mother's order and my order, so that's 3 mistakes. I ordered the sloppy Joe which had no flavor to it whatsoever and the waitress was very inattentive and couldn't seem to care less about serving us. The burgers do not come with fries or a side of any kind. And $31.00 for lunch for 2 people is a little pricey.   It will come back for dinner maybe.

bkyQR24IRhaRBuTcj2E0Qw.text: Went there last Thursday around 1:30 and there was a 30 minute wait. Once we were seated, we were greeted promptly and the server explained the menu. The food (two burgers, sloppy joe, tots and fries) was very tasty once it arrived. If you hate waits, I'd say give it 'til early February 2018 before checking it out.

v2IcswUF_7Dmyl-ufe26yA.text: This was our first time here. We were going to get a table. There was a 30-45 min wait not too bad considering it was 5:30. We sat at the bar to wait for the table but decided to eat at the bar instead. At first the two bar maids were a bit slow to get us drinks. But the 5 or so min wait was well worth it. They both were very nice and attentive. I am one I don't want to wait forever for a drink. They made sure I was not waiting for my next drink. My wife and I both got burgers she got a single and I did the double. We got fries and onion rings. The food was really good. We both really liked the onion straws. The fries were not the best but were just ok. We will definitely be back. The surprising thing was it was reasonably priced.

2I5mNoAO3hXSiS6qsNJbDw.text: After all the hype, I was very underwhelmed. The food was bland and the menu was boring. Maybe it's just because they are new and still learning? Although, I did enjoy the tater tots. I'll try again in a few months.

OX86lWCqWRGEm_dwWn6sfg.text: We only waited 13 minutes AFTER we were seated for someone to come to our table. 20 minutes AFTER ordering, I was told they were out of onion rings. 40 minutes AFTER ordering, we were told they were out of mac and cheese for our 2 kids. I had high expectations that were crushed. There are way better burgers elsewhere in the North Hills.

XtWSQ97KbDRA8Khufh0NXQ.text: This was our first time visiting a Wahlburgers.  Our server, Jill, recognized we weren't comfortable in a booth and suggested we move to a table.  Her service was quick, she was very bubbly and made suggestions from the menu.  Because of that, my husband changed his mind and was very pleased.  We didn't have to wait for refills and all food came out quickly.  You will be lucky to have her as your server.

vst8-vLQyCuRe3JnHyoccw.text: Went here for the first time today with my mom and 3 kids. It wasn't busy and the hostess told us she would be right back to help us then never came back and we saw her helping some tables. I had to ask someone else to seat us. Then we walked past the hostess who said she would help us but didn't and i heard her mumble some not so nice things to herself. Our waitress was friendly but only came over to bring or food. tkq2r27XUYLUPdG3RK2GVQ.text: Good Try Wahlburgers but your going have to do better in this foody City.We are spoiled with lots of good burger joints.From the Start:30 minute wait to be seated,another 50 mins to get our Food.A burger that is thinner than the thickness of your finger is not a burger.The "Onion Rings"aren't Onion Rings more like Fresh French's onion toppings.My chicken sandwich had the Onion Rings on it as a topping but you can get them as the side as well? WHAT DA HECK is that lol.This is nothing more than a gimmick and celebrity driven idea.Dave and Busters will be the competition when that opens and Wahlburgers won't be any more than a 1 and done thing.I wouldn't recommend to any burger Enthusiast and I see PITTSBURGHERS only eating here once.Average at Best and Manipulative Marketing.I don't like fast food but I'd say a step above fast food.

OHBWPIQEGQQ540UeqP_jhQ.text: My wife wanted to visit and had planned on it a long long time ago if we were to go visit where I grew up in southern New Hampshire we would go to the one in Boston area. I grew up with The New Kids on the Block and Marky Mark and the Funky Bunch. Then it was announced that this was opening up in the area and made plans to come eat at Wahlburgers. We had a little bit of a wait but we knew we would with the specialness of the place and how new it was. We got seated at a booth but it was too tight for me and the wife so we asked for a different table and were moved without hesitation. We ordered and waited and we got our order it looked really good. But my son who is picky saw black specs on his hot dog tweaked and wanted something else. Waitress got him something else and seemed like she didn't mind and cared that he wasn't happy. The burger was excellent however it was not gourmet. Price was not terrible and overall value was good. You have to expect with a famous co owners that it will be more about the experience of being there rather then just the food.

RxYDv2E94VJ22w006VdvFg.text: Very new, clean, and tasty. Wish the fries were a little better. I would definitely come back. My babe loves burgers and so do I. Worth the trip for sure.

vVStKGOadYfweH8t_h16wA.text: We first went to Wahlburgers shortly after they opened. It was mid-day during the week so there wasn't any crowd. We really enjoyed our food, but our waitress just wasn't very good. Don't get me wrong, she was very friendly, but once we got our food we didn't see her again until she brought us a check. I was hoping she would swing by because I wanted a refill on my water. But she never came back to check and see if the food tasted ok, or to see if we needed anything.   Since we really did enjoy our food, we went back a second time. Our waitress was much more attentive. She even gave us some Wahl sauce to try with our fries. So far my favorite thing I've tried was the chicken sandwich. But the next time I go, I've got to try the Mac and cheese.

RwMH_FFf0rWzS-exnbj32Q.text: I LOVED how much the servers knew about gluten allergies and what of their products were safe for me to eat! Thank you for being prepared for people with food allergies!

fNErEQuu8BUpunGXPSUpyQ.text: Had our first visit to Wahlburgers today. Of course, there was a wait for such a popular restaurant. It was definitely worth the wait. Fast service, absolutely great food and very inviting environment. We will be back with friends and family. Great job!

iMH_k_RDzq7I8AsNSm4UfA.text: I wanted to like it here. The burgers were good, reasonably priced. The sides (French fries & Mac and cheese) were not good. Fries were cold and starchy. Mac and cheese wasn't much better than boxed.

DoRV23r5Aa0ZOOxdhGvilA.text: We had to wait about 35 minutes to be seated on Saturday around dinner time. To be expected. Our waitress was very friendly. Had to wait a little while for our food and drinks. But that was all OK. I had the sloppy Joe and it was very underwhelming. Perhaps I am a snob, but my mother made the best sloppy Joe's and this was not even Close. It was very under season and it was slathered on top of a piece of white bread. Then topped with a rather Tasteless cheese topping. Perhaps the other items on the menu are much better, but I would never order this again or recommend it to anybody.

1QvGy9Ir4znM3FROytj7Vg.text: Im so glad Wahlburgers are finally in Pittsburgh Pa! Hope they open more in our Area! I had lunch at their Boston restaurant and tell you what was great Their thanksgiving Day burger its a killer! Their onion rings& Almas Macaroni Salad reminded me if my Aunts family picnic one. I would hope Donnie or Mark walk through door! You'll be satisfied eating here there portions are huge!

trduBYJuXLLo6-z6d5-26w.text: I just don't understand the hype at all.  Food was mediocre at best.   Previous reviewer said think Wendy's but priced no wait Wendy's is better.  It really is better than this place.

pjedVO0IL9422xtPR9rJPA.text: Wahlburgers exceeded my expectations. I went in thinking it would be just an average burger joint, with all of the hype generated by the owners being who they are. However, I was wrong. From the moment that I walked in the restaurant, to the moment that I walked out, I was impressed.   The decor was simple but branded very well to reflect the Wahlberg family. The service was very fast and all of the staff was super friendly. The menu is very easy to read and it's not overwhelming, like some restaurants can be. I liked how a lot of the sauces/dressings are all made in house. We did not even have to wait long for our meals to be served after our orders were placed.   I ordered a BBQ Bacon burger with fried pickles. I ordered a side of the signature Wahl sauce and ranch to go with my meal. The quality of the sauces and the taste complimented the pickles perfectly. My burger was cooked to perfection (medium) and was very flavorful. Our waitress was very attentive to our needs and provided us with exceptional service.   We ordered the grilled banana fluffanutta for dessert. This was one of my favorite parts of the meal! I would highly recommend trying it, if you save some room after your meal.  Wahlburgers truly exceeded my expectations by far and I will be returning in the future to taste different items on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Wahlburgers - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried Pickles
Photo of Wahlburgers - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. BBQ Bacon Burger

98en52fnUQp6MM2-NWr9wA.text: This was our first visit to the Wahlburgers in North Hills. After reading the reviews and failing to make an impromptu visit a few months ago, we decided to check in via the Yelp app so we could get on the list. Turns out this was a great decision because it was a 60 minute wait time when I checked in on the app. I was glad to not stand around for an hour after arriving at the restaurant.  When we checked in at the restaurant, there were only 3 parties ahead of us.  We were seated about 10 minutes after we got there. The chairs were metal, but strangely comfortable. The server came over right away to get our drink orders.  The hubs got a tap beer and I opted to try one of their spiked frappes, which was called the Hot Fudge Sundae.  When the frappe came out, it was pretty huge. Lots of fanfare with the icing and jimmies on the rim. The taste definitely was spot on. Both me and the hubs enjoyed the flavor. After the drinks came out, the server took our food order. Hubs got the BBQ Bacon burger, I got the Our Burger, and we split an order of Onion Rings.   The first thing I'll say is that the Onion Rings are not rings. They are those onion strings you usually get on top of a burger at that "other" burger joint. Because of this, they were a bit difficult to eat and I wound up using a fork. They were cooked well and tasted yummy, but they were definitely not rings.   The burgers were tasty as well. The meat was seasoned well and the burgers were the right temperature. The BBQ Bacon burger had only a very small amount of BBQ sauce on it, so the hubs requested more and our server brought it right over. The one negative about the burgers is they are pretty overly greasy. This caused the bottom bun to tear and disintegrate, which made it difficult to eat after a few bites.  The service was spot on. I was nervous because some of the reviews stated the service was not good and the accuracy on orders was lacking, but we definitely did not have that experience. Our server knew it was our first visit and was very helpful on explaining the menu items. She also provided us great attentive service throughout the meal.  In the end, it wasn't the best burger we've ever had, but it was a solid 3 stars and I'd say the excellent service would bump the entire experience to a 4 stars. While we may not make a point to visit again, we will definitely have it on our list if we find ourselves in the North Hills area during mealtime.

sOHJcY4XiXxWLcw8-vi4HA.text: So much better then I thought it would be! Crisp, hot fries, juicy burger with perfect bacon and tomato jam... Best was service. From host to kitchen to server, everyone was so friendly and happy you were there; often lacking in PGH - especially is casual dining. Bravo to management here. Will be back. FYI, good prices on wine and beer...

alasBCiw-QB2_nXsblVGmQ.text: I have only done take out from Wahlburgers so far. I liver pretty close and it is convenient to get to from my house. I have ordered from takeout several times. I always have ordered the same thing. Hamburger with bacon lettuce and tomato and french fries. Although generally the food is just warm at best by the time I get it home it is still really good. The french fries are delicious and the burger is always cooked perfectly. I will definitely continue to get food from Wahlburgers. I will definitely also make a effort to actually eat there so i can review the staff and service. Im sure that if you eat there and the burger is fresh off the grill it is much better.

R0fInD32f8oUGD-ftfIZvA.text: Walked right in and seated immediately tonight (Thursday) at 5:30. The place was busy but not packed. Our waiter was so friendly and service was very quick and efficient. The wahl sauce is amazing. The onion strings are a must have. Bacon Mac n cheese I had a taste but it bought it for my nephew and he loved it! OoOW8zIEeOSTb_RJ9wVKsg.text: At dinnertime on a Friday, there were 4 tables occupied with a sprinkling of customers at the bar.  I ordered a hamburger with barbeque sauce, jaleponos, avocado, bacon & government cheese.  Yes goverment cheese, which brought back memories of my grandmother's grilled cheese sandwiches.  I asked if a house salad was available, was told it was recently taken off the menu but one could be made.  I also ordered a side of onion rings.  The house salad had spring greens, cucumbers, tomatoes, and purple onions.  The Italian dressing was flavorful.  I had the avocado and jalapenos on the side.  The sandwich bread was smooched and disappointing. The bacon was crisp worked well with bbq sauce. I am not a great cook but my hamburgers are juicier and tastier.   The onion rings ... it appeared that an entire purple onion was sliced extremely thin, battered, thrown in the deep fryer, and never shook up.  I received a giant clump of onion rings.  My server suggested either the ranch or house wahl sauce for dipping. The ranch was thin and tasty. The wahl sauce was similar to thousand island dressing.  Both worked well.  Had the onion rings been sliced thicker, it would have been easier to eat.  I did enjoy the family's filmography on the ceiling.  My server was attentive.  Ample parking.   It just didn't work for me.

0PM4pBEjvEJvgOuNhPDaGg.text: Over rated and over priced. I was very excited to try this place out and I guess I had higher expectations.   The cocktail selection was just ok, I had a pineapple chipotle margarita that was drinkable, but hardly any liquor (I'm a bartender and there was not enough alcohol at all I couldn't even taste the triple sec) my girlfriend ordered an additional shot to add to her drink. I then followed with a strawberry jalapeno margarita that I sent back because the puree/ mixed they use was horrible. It taste like a spicy ass lipsmackers lip gloss drink. #yuck.   Because it's so open and echo-y it is very hard to hear the sever and she could barely hear us too. It was pretty cool looking though they had a light fixture of some sort that has all the movies the Wahlburgs have been in.   Our appetizer was fried pickles that weren't all the way crispy and even missing breading from the pickles them self. We both ordered a burger and we had fries and tots for our sides. I noticed there is a bin near the POS that is filled with containers of ranch, ketchup, mayo, etc sitting on some ice I believe. I found this to be very cheap and cheesy looking. If I'm paying $12 for a burger I would like just be around a little more class. The ranch didn't taste like ranch but a dill sauce. It was edible though.   So we get our food, it was ok, edible and not horrible. I got the bacon blitz cheeseburger (I was so hungry at that point I didn't take a pic lol) and my only complaint is when I bit into a piece a HUGE end piece of the caramelized onion was in my mouth and because it was the end, it was very hard and completely off putting.   We get our check and find out they charge separately for the fries/tots. I'm sorry but WTF kind of cheeseburger is sold WITHOUT FRIES. And $3.50 to boot! For POTATOES?! I dunno, If it was a classier setting I wouldn't of minded but we were sitting on chairs that weighed less than 5 pounds LOL. Our server was new and a sweety pie, but overall I probably won't eat there again. There are way better upscale burger places.

uoqGAB6m5VIt11VBUQ0qcQ.text: I stopped by here a couple of Sundays ago with my wife for dinner.  We were craving burgers and Wahlburgers happened to be nearby and so we headed on over and arrived to the restaurant at 7:15ish.  Since it was a Sunday they actually close at 8 and so the restaurant was decently dead.  There was a large bar area up front with both high top tables and the bar.  Behind that is a dining room and finally there is an outdoor space as well which is where we chose to sit.  There were a number of TVs tuned to sports and both my wife and I were able to watch the Yankees game which was on.  For dinner on this day I decided to go with the BBQ bacon Wahlbowl with a side order of French fries.  The menu describes the BBQ Bacon Wahlbowl as 1/3 lb burger, white cheddar, bacon, fresh jalepenos and homemade avocado all tossed with mixed greens and a housemade bbq dressing.  Both my wife and I were excited that they made the Wahlbowls as it felt like a healthier way to eat a burger.  It came to the table within a reasonable time period and looked pretty good with all of the ingredients displayed on the top.  My burger ended up being cooked nicely here and I enjoyed it paired with the cheddar and bacon.  Meanwhile the jalepenos gave the dish a nice spice and I did enjoy the  mixed greens underneath. As for the BBQ dressing, it was pretty sweet and so while I didn't mind it, any more probably would have been too much.  That was a little bit of a problem too as by the end of the bowl my greens were feeling a bit dry.  Still, I enjoyed this slightly different take on a burger.  The bottom line for me is that I would head back here again in the future.  I was impressed by the reasonable prices here and love the idea of burger bowls.

hps8wOUxu_DeaRsvZV_LPQ.text: This was our first trip to Pittsburgh, and our first experience at a Wahlburgers.  We had several great days helping our son move in, and we really enjoyed our meal experience at Wahlburgers.  My son and I had the Our Burger (excellent!), and my wife had the bacon Mac and Cheese (which son and I kept "trying out."  Outdoor seats were very nice, great food, great prices.  We definitely recommend!!

lM_tRcpXicurIgidllGoqA.text: Wahlburgers is a good restaurant with a cool atmosphere when in the mood for a burger! If you go on a weekend, make sure you use the "NoWait" app as there is usually always a wait. The burger salads are my favorite here, paired with one of their Wahlcoctions!

S13UCQBJlgT6IvADWuYtTw.text: I'll give the food a solid 4 stars.  Burger was good and greasy with plenty of flavor.  Now, let's turn to the menu. It is virtually uncomprehensable.  The "make your own burger" section offers a 1/3 lb (5.3 oz) single then a double which is 2, 3 oz patties.  2 x 3 oz = 6 oz....a full 2/3 of an ounce bigger than a single????  Then there is the triple which is 3, 3 oz patties of 9 oz.  I wanted the 8 oz burger that is featured in their gourmet burger section, but that is not available in the make your own section.  The waitress (who was helpful) said just order a gourmet burger and we will make it any way you want. ?? Well why isnt it offered in the make your own section.  So she puts in a Fiesta burger at the gourmet burger price and then just has it made with lettuce, tomatoe and onion.....at the gourmet burger price?  What did I just pay for? A basic burger or a gourmet with nothing on it?  I then asked....what comes with that. Nothing, I'm told....sides are all ala Carte at $3.50 a side....  Ok, so a $15 burger with fries? And 2 hours later, I am still trying to figure out what I paid for on the 8 oz burger that is not available.....  She asked if we wanted dessert.... I said "pass....I need an engineering degree to get a burger....dont need a doctorate to order dessert."

ri6Z5TEnJ3LgPmiso2k8qQ.text: Anticipation from hearing the hype and it was  barely average at best. In fact, we went two nights in a row to be fair and again barely average. Imagine double the price Wendy's, actually not as good as Wendy's. My family and I will never go back.

lJ-qCMFnWVhqz7PfGfUGgA.text: So I've waited a while to write this so I could properly do it justice and be honest without the excitement of the Wahlburgers brothers...I have been here about three times and each time I am wowed...I had three different burgers the first time I was here...the impossible burger, the double decker and marks thanksgiving burger and the last two times I stick to my favorite which I'll reveal a little later....first things first the decor of the restaurant is awesome with an laid back atmosphere.  Love the green chairs (actually wish I could just get one) and the decor has all the guys films on plus a sprinkle of Pittsburgh here and there...I have to say the burgers have a lot of thought and care and love put in to them and you can taste it in the sandwiches.  The impossible burger had a cheese that brought out the flavor of the burger and the sauce was a little spicy which livens it up a little bit...the impossible burger was a treat because I couldn't tell the difference between it and a regular burger...(now the Wahlburgers propriety blend you definitely can tell) it was also on a bun that had a semi toasted taste which made the burger pop!  I believe that this burger used its toppings and sauce to stand out and give it the taste unique to the Wahlburgers menu....the thanksgiving burger was not bad but definitely not my kinda thing...it was good but I have never been a fan of squash and the cranberry sauce...the burger was tasty and a great turkey burger patty definitely different from other turkey burgers...it was worth trying once but I'm definitely moving in to the Paul favorite burger the double decker....I will start out saying yes ilthis is my favorite burger and yes I think it's one of the best that I have ever had...the bun is a pillow of buttery goodness which almost has to be potato Roll and the toppings well executed with lettuce and tomato on it with the government cheese and fresh pickles it also has a juicy patty that isn't dried out and it melds together like a symphony of flavors....the sides I got were good we got the sweet potatoes tater tots and the smoked macaroni and cheese which is hands down one of the best Mac and cheeses I have ever had...the Pablo crumbs and the bacon is a great flavorful addition but the show is definitely inside the cheese sauce which is a creamy white mix that also has a smiley flavor which makes this a star of the sides at Wahlburgers...I can't say nothing bad about it the star power is there but the food, atmosphere and the family is all presented....got to meet the old lady gang here that was in the show and they are the most down to earth people you could ever meet....love this place hopefully there will be more built making their way towards Greensburg pa!

_OjaR2obtjVYU6R8_ZRxIg.text: We watch the wahlburgers show faithfully, and have anxiously awaited our visit to the Pittsburgh location (we used to live here, and came back to visit from out of town.). It was definitely worth the wait. Love it! Great food,  great location!  Hey guys, can you put one in the Harrisburg location?

photos.caption: Photo of Wahlburgers - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lunch with Wahlburg&#39;s

JQ8NCfqMlXvoX0K5V9yMqA.text: Atmosphere is open and casual. The waitress was friendly. The first appetizer, chicken buffalo dip was sent back, I mimicked cat food. The second appetizer was quest, it was okay. The salad was descent, good greens and chicken. The original burger was small but good. The Mac n cheese was nothing to write home about. The garbage can in the bathroom was overflowing paper towels. I doubt I will be back.

ppcjlrcOlDkQwkrHBZyErA.text: I have watched Wahlburgers, the TV show in the first season and so when I was looking for a lunch spot and saw that it was close by, I decided to check it out.   The venue is in what appears to be a new, upcoming location for dining and shopping - The Block. The restaurant is on the 2nd floor and is large, open, and airy. The color scheme is green and Black.   They had just opened for lunch and I was greeted and seated very quickly. My waitress, Christine, was extremely friendly and pleasant. She asked if I'd been here before and when I told her that I had not, she proceeded to go through the menu with me and explained the quality and type of meat used in the burgers. She then took my drink order while I made up my mind.q  I decided to try the sloppy joe. I'm sorry that I didn't try the Wahlburgers. It's not that the Sloppy Joe was bad, it just did not suit my taste. I think it might have been the addition of the cheese sauce and the Wahl sauce that was a bit off putting. I also prefer my Sloppy Joe on a bun instead of a slice of bread - but that's just me. The Thin Crispy Onion Rings were just that! They were hot and full of flavor, however, the house made pickles were a bit sharp tasting for me and I did not enjoy them. Beneath all of the stuff on top of the Sloppy Joe, the quality of the meat was excellent. Next time, I'll try their burger.   I don't know about the other servers, but Christine was great. She made the experience worth my trip even though I was overwhelmed with the flavor of the food.

8mZh0v-3I4Dbtt4WCS37rg.text: Omg.   They should stick to acting.   Absolutely awful.   I'm no a picky eater but it sucked.    Onion rings???    Is that what those were ?       The ranch dressing was so overwhelming with oregano that I couldn't eat it.   Never again thanks

vxDuYkf7L5XrNv_m7MYy7Q.text: Had great service last time. Very accommodating to vegans. I would say that this is a good place to go with the family. It's not overpriced. The desserts are good.

IWewHCnt6den1D-iY4JK0g.text: Very little good to say about this place.  So loud, you can't hear across the table. The service was extremely slow and I think he called us "boss" at least 45 times. Burgers were wrong, had to ask multiple times for sides. Definitely will not be going back.

LwhHGiOD_R5BJC5UkWet0w.text: Decided to go here with family for a quick lunch. Checked in online and waited 10 mins after we got there. It was more affordable then I would have imagined. Food was good, but burgers were paper thin. Guessing most ppl go for the hype of it being on a TV show. We went right when they were opening so wait staff was a bit scattered but service wasnt too too bad

NmovNIesTqWgweEkIJCTCw.text: I've been to the Wahlburgers in downtown Orlando, Florida and thought it was very good, so was glad to hear that they were opening a restaurant here in Pittsburgh.  I went on a Saturday afternoon, so expected the place to be packed, and it was.  I was by myself, so I took a seat at the bar as it was a 45 minute to an hour wait for a table.  The bartender, Brendan, was quick to give me a menu and pour me a Wahlbrewski.  I ordered a double decker burger with mushrooms, a side of Yukon Gold fries and a side of Alma's Classic Macaroni.  It took about 1/2 hour or so for my food to come, but again the place was jammed.  The food was great, awesome burger done just the way I like and of course the "government cheese" makes it!  Alma's macaroni was very good....Kudos to her as I assume it's her own recipe.  Brendan was a good server and did a great job considering he was taking orders AND manning the bar.  I wasn't expecting things to be perfect since the place just opened and I'm sure the staff is still adjusting and learning the ropes, but I can say that I wasn't disappointed.  The restaurant was bright, shiny and spotless, and the staff was very friendly and welcoming.  Now, since I live in the South Hills, I'm hoping they open another restaurant closer to me.

Photo of Wahlburgers - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu
Photo of Wahlburgers - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wahlburgers Pittsburgh - December 30, 2017

vSG1v3TxADVF3KP-bNV_ng.text: This Wahlburgers was a long time coming!!! After anxiously awaiting its opening, today was the day!! Since the grand opening isn't until January, today's opening wasn't advertised so it was nice to experience the environment of the restaurant without all the chaos of a full dining room. Our server was amazing. I tried the white wine sangria (which she recommended) which was a great blend of fall flavors you don't usually expect in a sangria. To eat, I got the sloppy joe and chili cheese double dog (actually a double decker hot dog!!!) with a side of sweet potato tots - I had to try as much as possible because I just couldn't make up my mind! I loved the idea of a sloppy joe at a restaurant and this one did not disappoint! It was open-faced and topped with onion straws and cheese  The chili cheese double dog not two separate chili cheese dogs, but instead one giant chili cheese dog with 3 pieces of bun and two whole hot dogs! It was a challenge to finish after the sloppy joe but I'm always up for the challenge!! The sweet potato tots were a perfect addition, and I would definitely recommend adding them to whatever you decide to try!

KMaIGJaPnv_LpXHg2kAmSQ.text: This has to be the best burger I have ever eaten. I got the Walburger nothing special just pickle, onions and Walburg sauce. It was cooked perfect hot and juicy. My wife had the portabelo salad awesome. Will be are go to place when I'm in town.

jXHkLS49MVVdrmK2d5Wblw.text: Burgers are great. Fries are good. Sweet potato tots are awesome. Service just awful. The service is gonna ruin this place for a lot of people before it even takes off. Service is slow and the bartenders have very little knowledge of the products here to top with a lack of "service industry common sense."  Common sense such as providing silverware, ketchup, and remembering your glass of wine... oh and knowledge of the "Wahlbrewski" such as what the ABV of it is. Hoping for improvements with their grand opening because the burgers are really great. They also need to fix the stocking issues as well they've been out of the "marks favorite" turkey burger both times we've been here.

U06tQMovlfwMspmfbcjdYQ.text: The sloppy joe did not disappoint! Plus I got the tater tots loaded with 4 cheese sauce & chili & it was only $5.50! Great price & size! Simple food with a kiss of gourmet flare. The waitstaff was incredibly friendly our waitress had a great personality so that made it fun. I purchased a souvenir shirt says 'Mom's Favorite' cracks me up since there are 4 kids in my family and we are all tied for last.

Y2zlZKoFQxuGJNO-D9bJMg.text: So for just having opened - it was actually very smooth!   They took our name and number and said it would be 60 to 90 minutes.  Immediately got a link that took you to Yelp and showed your place in line and we were 22nd.  In actuality it took about 40 minutes until our table was ready.  The waitress was very nice, forgot a couple of little things - but again, they JUST opened.  It probably took about 30 minutes for the food to show up, we all got burgers, and they were all good. 2 of us got their "house" burger and 1 got their Swiss mushroom burger with bacon - called the OFD - all were good.  We each ordered different sides, thin onion rings and tater tots that were good, Mac & cheese that was excellent and macaroni salad called Alma's that was was so-so.   I had a beer and 2 soft drinks - the bill was $56.  I'd definitely go back, but probably not a super regular stop.  They were far more together than I expected for a restaurant that just opened!  All staff was very friendly - again to be commended for a new place!!!

WTtbLr1nCJsmV4OisO3AHQ.text: I thought the food was very good! I went shortly after they opened, so there was a bit of a wait. Which is understandable. I'll be back for sure .

gNR4pCH0vwFwA8rtIOXncw.text: Over priced, burger with no sides. Food served in paper containers, like a fast food restaurant. Burger just average. Atmosphere cold and steril.

Zu7HzVeQh28wwyL-j8kyGw.text: Happy hour is half off drafts and cocktails , very very small menu. Service was good, not great.

z5DAPgok7AU6axnuIHDHGg.text: Eh, service was great with a friendly staff, though they don't take any to-go orders over the phone which is kind of a huge bummer. The burgers and tots were OK, but not really worth the price but I did love the open faced sloppy Joe! Was worth stopping in at least once.

vn5fbzTkP3oHwoUVnV0tjA.text: The burger here was just average. Really nothing to make me come back. The fries that accompanied my burger were cold. Asked for water with lemon and the water tasted just awful. I love Marky Mark, but maybe he needed a funkier bunch to make this better.

CPUnH0YLjYG6KGC9IzJC8w.text: Been to this place several times so far. This is a great burger place in Pittsburgh! Especially when you're craving fresh great quality delicious burgers and fries. I love their tater tots as well. I've personally tried "The Our Burger" and another time I had the "Crispy Haddock Sandwich". Everything was cooked to my like and I had mushrooms on my burger which was great. The prices are reasonable. The atmosphere is great. I loved the interior design of the place; they have the names of the movies that Mark Wahlberg appeared in written all over the ceiling. Creative! We've also enjoyed watching a football game while having dinner outdoors.

v3ObC_DKLZGBz7OkOsMj-Q.text: I had the Portobello Sandwich and onion rings. The sandwich was delicious! But $8.25 for a small sandwich with no sides is too pricey. I also had the onion rings which were good. My biggest issue with Wahlburgers is the seating. This may just be the most uncomfortable I have been in a restaurant. The seats are terrible. I fidgeted trying to find a comfortable spot the entire time we were there. Would give 2.5 stars if that were possible.

jg7RKpzK7ZVKyGeTwpai8g.text: Thought the food was mediocre at best.. I went there when they were first opening and the service was absolutely terrible. I watched them serve my food to the table next to us, saw those customers touch it, notify their server it wasnt there food.. the server took the food back to the kitchen and tried to deliver it to me about 30 seconds later as if I didn't notice..

D30ylXjlJ_8wyBVnjcJ-9g.text: Very disappointed my daughter had a burger it was very thin and greasy I had portobello sandwich very small for  the price. Mac and cheese was good.The waiters and staff were very nice service was very good Portion are small and pricey.

MuXRrd7caoPOcz57wher3Q.text: The burgers are good but you have to get onion strings or potatoes separately. A little pricey but I will definitely go back.  Hope to see Donnie

LAizJIePZxeX8U-UnLM0mA.text: My family went on a weekday evening for dinner. The place was pretty full of people and the atmosphere was noisy. Had to speak loud if you wanted your group to hear and there were a lot of 'what?' And repeating going on. Not a good place for conversation. There are TV's all around the place with various sports games playing. I ordered an Impossible Burger and I couldn't believe it wasn't meat. The burger was flat and irregular and came with caramelized onions. The waiter didn't seem to know which burger was what either so I had my husband taste it and he said it wasn't meat. I did enjoy the burger however in other restaurants I've had a thicker Impossible Burger...more bang for your money as these plant based burgers are pricey. Everyone else enjoyed their beef burgers. One person got a salad. There are other options as well such as a portabello mushroom sandwich. Fries are available to order as a side and do not come with the burgers. This seems a little off putting but I never eat all the fries anyway so my husband and I shared an order. Biggest disappointment was the onion rings... they were not in fact rings but the shoestring thin style.  Overall a good place to have a burger and watch sports.  What???? BURGERS AND SPORTS! Oh, cool.

8SsMjBF9uRLgZ7G5365N0g.text: I was close to giving Wahlburgers three stars, but it isn't quite there for me. There's honestly not much to say and overall the entire place is just incredibly average.   The quality of the food is alright, but the prices are equal to or slightly higher than most other restaurants in this category. From the exterior, it looks like an airport restaurant - the sports bar atmosphere is fine, but the seating isn't particular comfortable. Our server was moderately attentive and pleasant, but definitely not setting the world on fire.  I didn't hate Wahlburgers' food the same way I didn't hate "Daddy's Home," "The Italian Job," or "The Other Guys." There are much better options in the area, but you could also do worse.

4E9UlNPvdEjuFYvx3JzpIw.text: Not impressed at all. The thing that makes me mad, is when you order a burger here, they charge you an extra 3.50 for your fries. hZSeUMrbZ8KezY6E4S2_uQ.text: I want to give it a five, but the service was horrendous okay that's harsh, but he wasted so much time, we sat so long. 0ZYTSQLlyverOVs7nq3MVA.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the burger and look forward to one opening in Robinson, so I can try the turkey burger. I figured I had to get a normal burger my first time there. I love that the burgers and sides are separate, since I was pretty full and able to JUST order a burger. QZoT56adNZcz4aAIt6CMlQ.text: We ended up at Wahlburgers because there was a long wait at Burgatory. Walked right in and were seated. They are on No Wait so I had checked prior to heading there so that was handy. I didn't realize they had outdoor seating (covered deck) so that was a nice surprise. It's overlooking the parking lot and road so don't expect a view!  I had the Our burger and onion "rings". This is a total misnomer. It says on the menu that they are "thin and crispy" but not that they are onion straws. That's what they are. I'm not sure why they don't just call them that. Maybe because nobody really wants an entire basket of onion straws? I think if them as a burger topping, not a side. And at $3.50 it was steep for a side. They tasted good but it was a bit strange. The burger was a burger. I wasn't wowed but it was good.   The kids menu had your standard fare and both of my kids had the chicken fingers and fries. The waitress brought out both honey mustard and their special sauce for dipping. The honey mustard was more mustard than anything but it was good (and she said homemade, which is a plus). The special sauce was similar to McDonalds but with a very, very slight kick. (Very slight)   Waitstaff were all friendly and draft beer was half off for happy hour. Not a bad experience overall but definitely not stand out either.

5e0DOjEsaTuQ5JOPmmplhg.text: I have been to Wahlburgers in other cities and was happy to finally get to one near home.  My wife and I split buffalo chicken dip, fries, and the impossible burger.  All were delicious.  Aside from Burgatory, this was the best impossible burger I have had.  A lot of places do not do them right and you end up getting a dried out patty that does not resemble meat.  Wahlburgers was juicy and tasted delicious.  The buffalo chicken dip was just ok.  I love their fries with their homemade ranch dressing.  The ranch they use is different than most other places, very dilly.

zBqShV7nBBBxzsHZ7VBgFg.text: At best! This place is mediocre and very pricey. $14 for the cheapest burger and fries. And just ok quality and toppings. I ordered a BBQ bacon  burger minimal BBQ sauce on it but jalapeno and avocado was tasty. The Wahlbrewski's were tasty but again pretty average as well. The service was good, our server was very attentive and polite telling us the many options available. This place is WAY over hyped and too many better options to spend $75 for a lunch. Too many better cheaper options to say I'd be back here again. Sorry Wahlburgs's you got enough of my money.

22EWC8W6RZMq-Kl_L8mSkA.text: We purposely waited for the initial hype to die down before heading out into the North Hills suburbs for a burger.  Let me say that it was good, pretty damn good and I'll even go as far as ranking it up there with my beloved Shake Shack.  My boyfriend and I went with two friends. Two of us had the "Our Burger", another had the plant based "Impossible Burger" and my boyfriend had the "Pittsburgh Burger" aka "Smashed Pierogi" Burger.  Our meat was cooked to our requested temperatures and the burgers were juicy and full of flavor. The government cheese really adds to the beef.  A basket of onion rings is enough to feed a family of four. No joke.  Split the "adult" hot fudge sundae shake with the boyfriend and it was yummy. Just the right amount of cherry vodka.  We made a trek specifically to check it out. As good as the food was I can't see leaving the city for another visit unless there's a need to head out that way and of course we'd eat there again.  Our server was a great kid, very personable. I liked that the manager made rounds to make sure customers were happy.  All-in-all a great experience.

Xt3lht3hsDX-dzueaATCzA.text: Was craving the impossible burger and happy to have found they offer it here!   We were greeted promptly and chose to sit on the outside patio. Our server, I believe Christine, was amazing!! We started with Jalepeno margaritas and buffalo chicken dip. The chips were seasoned heavily, which I love, and the dip was very good. I thought it could be a little spicier and thicker but it was still yummy.  For my order I obviously had the impossible burger. I couldn't decide between fries or tots so Christine was sweet enough to allow me to try both. She also brought out their homemade cheese sauce without us asking and WOW am I glad she did. Such a good tangy flavor! It's a must to accompany the tots. My burger was very good and tasted like regular burger meat. It was cooked perfectly without being over or undercooked. I loved the aioli on it! The grilled onions were a little much for me on top but I just took the majority of them off.   If you are in the mood for a relaxed bar setting with great sandwiches then this is a great spot. I must say Christine really made our experience complete!

iBJR6vtDDY4I8KXvrgPbjg.text: Probably my second favorite burger of all time! Had "The Our Burger" and it was done perfectly medium well as I asked for which never happens anywhere else. The house made pickles and sauces are the best. As a side I chose Alma's Mac Salad and it was nearly the best Mac salad you could ask for. Top this place off with a great happy hour special of 1/2 priced drafts and $5 appetizers and you can be sure to have a good visit

GwueTuyjlVYqHqp3B-lLbA.text: This was my second visit to Wahlburger's. I enjoyed the first experience with a friend and decided to bring my sister. Sadly there were some disappointing moments to this experience.   The appetizers were a highlight of our experience. We ordered the Spicy Queso & Roasted Corn dip with Chips and the Fried Pickles. Both were flavorful and hit the spot. For our main course, we got the Jenn's Chicken Wahlbowl and the BBQ Bacon Wahlbowl. They were decent salads but nothing to write home about.   Unfortunately service was a low point. The server Wendy did not seem efficient. When she came by the table, she would tell us a special and then walk away without taking our orders. This happened several times and it took much longer than we planned for our lunch.   We did enjoy the Lemon and Carrot Cake cupcakes for dessert. That put a spring in our step as we walked out the door.

mEOeb9I18183FNhXbhqqFg.text: Quick sit down place to grab a burger, a brew, and some very filling sides.  I ordered the "Our Burger" which was basically a cheeseburger done their way, even though the Thanksgiving Turkey Burger was calling my name. Need to try the basics first! The burger was cooked to my liking, and the toppings were in good proportion. I did think the pickles were on the slightly thick side, but did have a nice crunch. The fries were alright, and probably would taste better if they they were served "loaded." The thin and crispy onion rings were super delicious, and plentiful! Throw a few on your burger before you finish either of them!  (We took a bit of the onion rings home and had them the next day - reheat in a warm skillet)   Also not to miss, even with its silly name is the Wahlbrewski, one of their beer offerings. Our server said it starts like an IPA, and finishes like a Bud Light. I am not a fan of IPAs, but never tasted whatever IPA flavor it was supposed to have. It was a darn good beer and paired very well with the burger, and it tasted more like a lager than anything. They'll grab you a sample if you're not sure. Beer not your thing? They have plenty of other sodas, floats, and frappes to whet your whistle!

photos.caption: Photo of Wahlburgers - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Our Burger, order of Onion Rings, and a Wahlbrewski

LENuWqE-ih-G-bFHs-qXgQ.text: Came here for the first time for lunch on a weekend.  Hubby and I ordered the spicy cheese and bacon tots as an appetizer.  I ordered the portobello mushroom burger and hubby ordered their Latin spice burger (which is seasonal).  Total (w/o tip) came out around $26.    What's hot - Quality.  Their tots and burgers are pretty good.  I've had better, but it's pretty good.  For example, my portobello burger had really nice caramelized onions.  The smaller mushrooms were nicely sauteed.  With the caramelized onions, the flavor was pretty good.  - Layout/location.  It's located within the mall, which is easy to find.  However, it's on the 2nd floor, so you need to find your way upstairs.  There's no outside entrance.  Inside is a pretty decent layout, as well.  There are booths, individual tables, and a bar. - Menu/variety.  There's something for everyone.  Again, there are veggie options.  It's not a large menu, either, which is nice.  Not overwhelming.  There are appetizers, burgers, sandwiches, sides, drinks, etc...  Everything pretty much fits on one page.   - Service is good.  They seem adequately staffed, but the restaurant wasn't full when we were here.  On a side note, I asked for jalapenos to be added in my mushroom burger (which is noted as a free add on, on the menu).  The jalapenos were missing in my burger.  What's not - Price.  For the amount they charge for their mains, it's kinda pricey.  For example, hubby's burger was $12 and doesn't come with a side.  You have to pay extra for sides.  For what he ordered, he wasn't full.   - Portions.  Decent.  The burgers are about the size of a McDonald's burger.  The main difference is the thickness/add ons.  It depends on what kind of burger that makes it filling.  The burger itself is not big.  Additionally, as I mentioned above, the burgers do not come with sides.  The sides are separate.   - Not spicy.  The spicy cheese and bacon tots were not spicy.  Hubby's Latin spice burger was not spicy either.  There was a veery light kick at the very end and it was barely noticeable.  My point is that if you're expecting a good luck of spice, you won't get it here.  Final answer Willing to come back, but it's not a first choice.

lyHQWt93JeyQap1NPbxdYw.text: This place is seriously bad. Visited on a Saturday at 3:00 pm....waited 45 minutes for a table after watching party after party being seated before us. They claimed it was because we were a party of 5 and couldn't find the space for us. So we laughed after we finally got seated (after a lot of complaining) and they pulled up that extra chair to put at the end of the table. Wow....what a great idea!  When we got our food, they came over and auctioned it off...yelling out the orders and waiting for one of us to claim it. And the burgers were nasty. All completely over cooked and had no flavor.  Wendy's and Five Guys blow this place away. $60 later (only 4 of us ate and we had no alcohol), we vowed never again. Total waste of time and money.

w0Mb_WAZsiXOYmXsd4q8Vg.text: Mediocre at best.  It was like going to Burger King in every way, except you have to wait 30 minutes.  There were 5 of us, we all got burgers.  The waitress asked how we wanted them cooked -- there were 2 for medium rare, 1 for medium and 2 for well.   All five burgers came out well.   Burger is a teeny tiny patty that was over cooked. No flavor. just salty.  Even a McDonald burger is better.   Service was poor. My favorite is when they bring the food to the table and "hold an auction".  They yell out the name of the food and hope someone raises their hand and claims it.  Of course there was confusion and we weren't sure if we didn't have each other's food, so the waitress argued with us.   Seriously, just skip this one.

GbTKdAqXRSx7TTH9GqJhuA.text: Wahlburgers in Pittsburgh (Ross Township) is bad. I don't mean it was just a mediocre experience after a 40 minute drive and 1.5 hour wait. It was seriously bad in contrast to even if it was down the street from home with no wait after all the advertisement, hype, and price. Actually, there are so few positive things to say that I'm going to start with them because one might not make it to the end of the review and I do want to give credit where it's due.   The good: 1) Kind FOH staff - Everyone came off very friendly. The waitstaff was rightly apologetic when things went wrong and willing to make attempts to satisfy needs. The bar tender provided service to us at the service bar since the bar was full and we were waiting quite a while. 2) The actual flavor of the burger was ok. It doesn't crack the top 5 or even the top 10 in Pittsburgh but I'd eat it again. To be fair I was hungry on my way there and after 1.5 of waiting was starving. I had "Donnie's Fave" .. BBQ bacon burger as I do anywhere so I can fairly compare to others as it's a staple meal for me. Don't dream of getting anything as good as Tessaro's, Burgatory, BRGR, or even Primantis. We're talking higher end fast food quality like maybe if Chick Fil A made burgers, which doesn't make sense because they aren't even doing take out at Wahlburgers and there is no drive through. The sweet potato tots were kinda bland but not bad either. It's a far far cry from the "high quality ingredients" they boast on the website or all of the hype it has gotten.  The bad: 1) Terrible, and I mean terrible, attention to detail. At 8:30pm on 1/7/18 long after the dinner rush died down the server did not serve our party of 6 with food all at once, nor 2 or 3 or 4 trips. It took 5 trips just to deliver everyone's meals and sides over a span of 15 minutes. The excuse was that my burger was dropped and had to be remade but that didn't excuse the structure of service consisting of 3 other deliveries spaced out over 13 minutes brought out one or two at a time. He and assisting servers failed to return with obvious accessories required with food such as a spoon for chili (4 requests), originally ordered side of ranch (4 requests), silverware (2 requests), and forgotten sides.   2) What even is this food quality and is this serious?! Chili is legit Wendy's or identical to Wendy's fast food chili and this is no lie 3 times the price that Wendy's is serving it for. The fries and tater tots are exactly what I've been getting at the grocery store on sale 2 for $5 bags of Ore-Ida brand served at room temperature in a smaller portion. The thin crispy onion rings are not rings at all and by thin I think they mean possibly "the edge of a butter knife" thin. I expected petite loops of deep fried onion. We got shreds of stuck together onion hairs? Think a generic off-brand version of French's crispy fried onions that your aunt tops her green bean casserole with. Yeah, that was the side of onion rings. The mini penne Mac n cheese is not mini. It was some of the larger penne I've seen and someone literally tossed a handful of shredded cheddar over noodles, microwaved it, then stirred. I kid you not that the 3 year old trying to eat it said "this is terrible" unprompted before anyone else did which might have been the best part of my night there. Nothing was served hot or even pretty warm.  3) Priced at about $120+tip for party of 6, two of which were kids and included 4 beers (kids drinks were prepaid while waiting and not included in the meal total). Could have easily gotten better food in a place with similar items for much less. Places I'd rather go: Red Robin, Friday's, Applebee's, all the way down to Wendy's and even Steak N Shake.    Notes:  Funny that the people who waited after us in line approached our table after their meal to confirm it was the lamest experience ever. Even though we hadn't even finished yet they received the yes nod. You aren't crazy ma'am, this sucks.  There was an NFL playoff game on and we were stuck watching Mark Wahlberg talk (probably good about himself and his family's restaurant) on mute for 20 minutes while a host struggled to change it to something the whole place wanted to watch.

6rA-OYvGt1WB0Rq6HEpaFw.text: Russell B at Wahlburgers Pittsburgh. Great service, great food and friendly staff. Clean bathrooms. Gluten free options are wonderful!

tiTtu68o86GAVCajORfVGA.text: Third time here. Wife and I ordered the regular burger and she had the chicken Cobb salad. I also had fries. Eveything was aweful. Burger was not of good quality and tasted like frozen beef. Lettuce was shriveled and a bit brown. Only thing good was the Walls sauce. Fries were over priced and served in a little cup. Folks they are aweful frozen fries, cheap quality but they charge a fortune for. Wife salad had very little chicken and no variety of ingredients for a Cobb salad. Finally let's talk about the bar. We sat at the bar so we could watch a game and I ordered a rum punch and wife ordered a pomegranate martini. Was told they can not make a pomegranate martini. Ok so she ordered a cosmo. Both drinks were $9 each. There was not much alcohol in either drink. We watched her pour. Then they have the nerve to ask $9 each. Totally a rip off. We left most of our food and the bartender didn't even asked. When I mentioned the drinks being weak, he said, the management watches them pour to make sure there is no over pour and they were sorry but she didn't want to lose her job. She never mentioned the fact that half our food was left. Hence why there was no one except my wife and I at the bar. We are done here. Too many other places that have better food and much better drinks. Also went into the men's room and it was disgusting. So there you have it. Go else where

fWMmWxotadkGxu_fpltCmQ.text: Went here on the spur of the moment on a Thursday night. Promptly greeted very nicely by the hostess and told it would be about 15 minutes. No big deal. Looked for a seat at the bar and the server working the bar area pointed out an empty table we hadn't seen. So our 15 minutes turned out to be 5. So far so good.   The good: 1. Service was good. The server promptly greeted us and gave out table a little extra wiping. Drink orders taken quickly and brought to the table quickly.  2. The menu is ok. After all, it is a burger place but there are several selections available if you don't want a burger.  3. Ordered my burger medium and it was actually medium. That seems to be hard to find anymore. The burger was very tasty and really just the right size.   The not so good ( don't want to say bad because it wasn't. Just eh) 1. $3.50 for a side of tots or fries with my burger? They don't come with? I saw that on the menu and assumed it meant if I wanted a side order of them not pay or you don't get them. Both the tots and my wife's fries were nothing I couldn't get an entire bag of at Giant Eagle for the same price.  2. The TV's showing what I assuming was the Wahlburg's reality show was a bit weird. It was on at least 2 TV's with no sound. Not that I wanted to hear it but I think having shows that require you to listen on in a bar is stupid.   Overall I think this place is, meh. Nothing special and nothing to make me want to return. I think the best description is; it's not a place that you plan to go to but rather somewhere you end up at.

We arrived at 5:20 and put our name in and they said 45 minutes. We had a toddler with us but decided to wait anyway because we figured by the time we got back in the car and went somewhere else it would take just as long. After 45 minutes passed, we still hadn't been notified so I went up to ask. They stated that there were still 6 parties ahead of us and that it would be another 25 minutes. At that point our toddler had had it and we couldn't wait longer. I understand being off by 5 minutes or so in an estimate but 25 minutes is far too much, and that's assuming it actually would be 25 minutes because now we know their track record for estimating is terrible. They should always overestimate if they feel they have this problem especially when it's a busy restaurant with people frequently waiting.

knOIFwKPdO4fGihvOan81A.text: Wonderful dining experience!  My family and I decided to give Wahlburgers a try this weekend, and were very pleased with both the service, and the quality of our food.  We were seated immediately, and greeted promptly by our server, Russell, who was super helpful, and friendly.  After some debate, we wound up going with the Melt, Mom's Sloppy Joe, Jenn's Chicken Sandwich, and a children's entree.  We also ordered the sweet potato tots, onion rings, and the mac and cheese with smoked bacon.  Our food came within twenty mins, and each entree / item was better than the next, although, I personally had the seared chicken sandwich, which I highly recommend.  The smoked mac and cheese was amazing, as well.    So glad to have another family friendly, affordable, delicious dining option in the area, and look forward to a return visit to Wahlburger's soon!

-icumPq41iuUI-AGEkn77g.text: My husband and I were so excited to try this place. I am a huge fan of this family. I wentNeedless to say by the end I just wanted to leave. There was a small wait, however there was space at the bar. Being that we had an hour drive back home we decided to take the bar. We did get drinks within five minutes of sitting down. Our order was taken about 20 minutes later. When our food came out, we needed silverware. Took ten minutes to flag down the bar tender. He was to busy talking to someone about about how Mark hates being called Marky Mark and how he's so excited about the appearances that will be made this year. Also talked  about them being 2/3's owner of the Pittsburgh location. He finally saw I wasn't eating my food and came over. Took another probably 15 minutes for him to bring it to me since his conversation was more important than my now cold food not being eaten. My husband and I both ordered fries, which the container was maybe half full. No biggie for me due to my not being a big eater, but if those are the portions then why make people pay extra for them?! I waited for nearly 10-15 for a refill on my drink. I had it sitting on the edge of the bar. Even took it off and but it back down just in case he didn't notice the first time. My burger probably would have looked better coming from McDonalds and I hate fast food. If your looking to try something with a great experience and good food try something else. I heard Burgatory is opening up another location nearby so I doubt this place will last if something isn't changed.  To update from my last review. The owner quickly responded to my review from before! Was really nice. My husband and I went back with some friends and our experience was a lot better. Service was great! Food was fantastic. We used the No Wait app, so we didn't have to wait long either. We have gone back a couple of times since and have had positive feedback for each time.
