yZSSYaJsDhGDkqChe9mk0Q.text: I finally got a chance to come here,  and so glad I did,  it was me and my twin sister birthday done picked this place for our family dinner,  it was such a good time and great food  I went to one in Myrtle Beach back in March and loved it so I couldn't wait to go to the Pittsburgh North hills location,  our server jess was very nice the whole staff there was friendly,  will definitely return

ZW5aX9CDk17EJw8jaJggUw.text: We were just there and had a wonderful experience. Our waitress Wendy was great , gave us  some suggestions, talked with us ,brought over more pictures of Donnie  as a joke. The manager Candace came over and talked with us. The food was hot and very good . We had very prompt service .

t5ZApZv6RVL4Y8bWq8J0Zg.text: This place is unbelievably overrated and overpriced. The food is mediocre, at best. The service was not great on a night when the restaurant was half empty. The burgers were okay - not spectacular and by no means worth the hefty price tag. $13 for a burger with no side. $3.50 for 4oz of frozen fries (which were cold and clearly not fresh).  The thanksgiving burger was literally the same texture throughout. You could have eaten it without teeth. Zero flavor interest. It tasted entirely like butternut squash despite having cranberry sauce, which should have been a noticeable pop. Our server didn't put in our appetizer order, so I can't comment on what we ordered. At least she was honest and didn't blame the kitchen.

D4KSXe4ZqPjIOWiqPVytxQ.text: Me an my wife stopped at Wahlbugers in the North Hills.I ordered the Paul's favorite with cheese, lettuce, tomato,bacon an mayo withe regular tator tots.My wife had the OFD an sweet potato tots.We both ordered our burger med well done.It came to the table in a timely manner.Our burger were burnt  an way past well done.An the sweet potato tots were so hot you couldn't eat them.They waitress asked if everything is ok an my wife said hers is way done.I didn't complain an just ate mine because I was hungry.The waitress took my wife's off the bill.After we ate an paid our bill.Which is about 20 mins.The sweet potato tots still were real hot.Not worth it to me an I don't complain about food to often

UT6YhSEoMU8MwMM1RtvXLA.text: It's good.  But not great   Tater tots are yummy.  For the money I'd go back.   But if you can spend a bit more I'd go to BRGR.   We had the chicken sandwich, that wasn't bad, the regular single burger , the double burger , fries and tater tots. Chicken sand was ok. Burger was thin, little flavor. Fries were bland wouldn't order again.  Tots were very good   Pittsburgh location

AbUZSJmUdFiRNtngIpSiFQ.text: After hearing so many things about Wahlburgers, I finally decided to give it a try. Don't believe the hype. I ordered my 1/2 pound OTD burger medium and it came out gray throughout - definitely not medium. The flavors were average and nothing special. The mac and cheese with bacon was also subpar. The bacon was on top and was so hard, it was borderline inedible. Upon leaving, there were two hostesses at the front - neither said thank you or come again. Overall, a very disappointing and subpar experience. Not recommended.

vr5vzIJJPLbMvVxjBq_Iig.text: It was time to give this place another shot, which I did on Sat 3/10/2018.   We got there at around 3:30 pm and it was pretty busy in the dining area, so we decided to add our name/number to the waiting list.  About 5-10 mins later a table opened up in the bar area, so we went and sat in there.    Immediately, someone came over to wipe down the high top table for us.  Shortly after that the manager came over and gave us menus and asked us if we wanted anything to drink.  So far, so good!  Then our waitress came over with silverware and napkins and talked with us for a bit.  She was fantastic!!  We started with the Sweet Potato Tots and Thin Crispy Onion Rings, which were both fantastic and highly recommended.    Next, I ordered the "Our Burger" and my counter part ordered the "Triple Decker", both with white cheddar cheese and a side of Crispy Yukon French Fries.  They were both cooked the way we wanted and were so very good!!    This was a total 180 from the 1st time I was here.  I definitely recommend you stop there and I know I'll be back....THANK YOU!!!

gOiPUuGvIqIUEDNMbHTj-w.text: I love it here. Their sloppy joe is amazing. Come to think of it, everything I've ordered there has been amazing

LWKd-OotaWKx5ioLctZTmg.text: Needless to say, I am disappointed. I was prepared for the wait, no problem there. The service and the food were sub par to say the least, four of the five orders were incorrect when the arrives to the table. Actually, three of them were not even ours. If this is the soft opening I certainly hope that better preparations are in place for the grand opening and continued business. When you spend $80 on burgers and fries, you expect a little more. Step it up Wahlburgers !!

UnPpG8pPN8aXzA7U22-uDg.text: Be prepared to shower after you leave here as you and your clothes will remind you of Wahlburgers long after you leave...like a bad hangover after a late night in the bar.  Apparently Mark W. was in town on Sunday 12/17 for the Steelers/Pats - he managed to get to the box but should have gone to his newest installment of his family restaurant chain.  Loooong wait, on a Wednesday night, which I get as it is new.....that said, so not worth the wait.  We had hoped to really enjoy - this was my nephew's choice for a belated bday celebration - what a disappointment!  A few of us ordered the "our" burger and expected it to come with the toppings they list...only came with cheese.  When we asked the "manager" about it, he said (all with a cheesy and disingenuous smile) that we should say we want it "set" going forward, and that we would stump his staff if we said that.  How would we possibly know this?  We had a party of 7, some burgers (not "set") and some chicken.  The chicken was good, nothing special.  The onion rings were like French's canned onion strings.  We weren't given any utensils.  Oh, and did I mention that not only was the wait long, the wait for the food was even longer....and we were served the wrong dishes, all seven of us...nothing comped, no apology from the management on the late, wrong food or the "set" burgers.....the funky bunch has its' work cut out for it....

x53P8HB7Bm0QSalCuBWQ6g.text: I've decided to update this review because I was finally contacted by someone within the restaurant management and invited to come back to try it again, so we did so.  This time around, the service was much more attentive, and all of our orders came out correct.  Someone at the table tried the Thanksgiving burger, which he said he far preferred to the regular burger that he had the first time around.  The waitress did a good job suggesting different sauces and condiments to try, and the manager stopped by personally to apologize for our prior visit and to encourage us to offer any feedback we felt might help.  Whereas some of this improved experience might have been intentionally focusing on us because of our prior complaints, we agreed we'd give this another shot in the hopes that maybe now that they've ironed out some of the kinks with management and staffing, that they might be more consistent.  There are still some issues that put this place further down on my list than some other burger restaurants (i.e. the fact that all sides are ala carte, the lack of any kind of shareable appetizers for the table), but that's just what the business is, and not a fault with this particular location.  If you live in the area and don't already have it, download the NoWait app.  It's great for a lot places, but since this place is smaller and always busy, it's nice to be able to "get in line" and then leave for the restaurant once you see your table is getting close to being ready.

YQ9bbAmw23OaUx0f4FhhGQ.text: Been wanting to try this new burger spot. Don't waste your time or money. Lets start with the atmosphere; bright, cartoonish and very spread out. Wait staff was friendly, but the host was clueless. Moving on tothe drinks, stick to beer or soft drinks. Terrible wine and cocktails, sent 3 back. The spiked cherry coke tasted like cough syrup and the strawberry something tasted like sour cotton candy. When taking our food order, the server recommended the burger be medium well. Hmm. Never heard that at a burger joint. Very small menu, could be a food truck. Food was just ok. Burgers lacked flavor. For 2 drinks, 2 burgers, tots and onion rings, the bill was $70. Don't mind paying for a good experience, this wasn't one. And btw, spent most of my night in the bathroom. Yuk!  Also notice that corporate only thanks good reviews, how 'bout a sorry for all the unhappy diners. Stick to the burger you know....

e2aQX1mSZCudC6nD-X8new.text: Went on a Tuesday around 1pm. It's was a 20 minute wait time.  Host staff seemed nice but didn't seem to know what was going on between the three of them!  After we were seated 10 minutes later our waitress came over just to tell us she would be with us in a moment.  We did not see her again for about 5 minutes. She asked what we wanted we just ordered two waters and waited another 10 minutes just to get water.  Now 20 minutes after being there we finally get something to drink and are able to order .  My husband ordered the 2 hot dogs and I ordered the Jenny Chicken sandwich.  We did not get our food for 35 minutes.  We had to ask for silverware and our waitress never asked if we needed refills for our drinks we had to ask her for refills and took her over 5 minutes to get us refills.  As we were eating we watched our waitress drop food on the floor clearing a table and clean it up with her hands.  I watched her and she never washed her hands she went and picked up a food order.  I will say the food was amazing but the wait staff will take this place under.  As much as I liked the food I probably won't be back due to the wait staff . All in all we waited over an hour to get food and drinks.   Our waitress name was Margaret and was very overwhelmed.
